This institution is a neat experience and a must if you are passing through or live in the Charlotte area.
1st time today And it was busy but they were fast getting order's out But the food was was Great will go back again

Awesome fried chicken!  Quick lunch service even when they're busy-take out only.  An easy walk from the Lynx Bland Street station.  They only take cash but do have an ATM machine wedged in the corner.

This place is old school. Bring cash and hang up your stupid phone. Seriously, they wont serve you while on the phone. It's mainly known for the fried chicken but, my fav is the BBQ. The cole slaw and the sweet tea are very good.

We were in Charlotte for a few days and we had to check out the famous Price's Fried chicken Coop. It did not disappoint. the chicken itself was great, I wouldn't say the best I've ever had like some of the other reviews but it's right up there, the Cole slaw was awesome. But I think what makes this place great is the family atmosphere, nothing fancy it's a very basic down home southern chicken joint with friendly workers.

Went for the first time today, I've heard only good things about the food so I i had to try it!! The fish sandwich was the Bomb!!! Friendly service and i was in and out in less then 3 mins!! I'm definitely going back!!

If you thought you've had fried chicken before you've been kidding yourself!    Price's Chicken Coop is a little intimidating for a newcomer (it can be VERY crowded) but just remember these two tips: bring cash and pick a line.  If you follow these two rules one of the sweet old ladies who work the registers will have you out of there in no time eating the best chicken of your life.  No, they don't take plastic (although there is an atm inside), and no, there is nowhere to sit.  Get over these two facts and you are on your way to a delicious meal of fried chicken and whatever sides you choose!  Right now they have a dark meat 'sandwich' meal (consists of 2 pieces of dark meat, slaw, and a roll)  for about 3 Dollars.  I usually grab that and go across the street to the grassy area and munch down a quick lunch or snack.  Everything I've ever had there is great...but their specialty is the fried chicken so I would strongly recommend that to new-comers.  The thing I love most about Price's Chicken Coop is that it brings people of all walks of life together with the common interest of good fried food.  The customers come from all walks of life and the employees and patrons are very friendly, even under the busiest of circumstances.

I got around to driving here for lunch one day and wow I could smell the place before I could see it. I don't have much fried chicken experience but their chicken is moist, tender, and crisp on the outside. Knowing it's probably a heart attack in a box makes it even more delicious! Sweet tea is quite a foreign concept to me coming from out west, but after one sip I had to buy another cup. I wish there was some form of seating available though, maybe a couple chairs outside or something at least?

Been on my to do list for years but finally got around to a visit.  With the exception of 3 years in Ohio and 6 years in PA, I've lived in Charlotte or the Charlotte Area since 1970. This place has been around since 1962 and has had great reviews for years for simple fare done right.  The history reminds me a bit of Premanti Bros in the Strip District in Pittsburgh. Both got their start as small restaurants serving worker in nearby warehouses and factory's and developed a very loyal following. When I lived in the Pgh area, the Strip District was enjoying the start of a revival and becoming a destination. When I moved back to  Charlotte, the area around Price's which is called South End was also enjoying the beginning or a revival and today with commuter rail, has become a destination in of itself with massing amounts of housing being built.  One reason I've never made it here before is because when I'm in Charlotte, I'm there for something else and I forget about it.  There was speculation in some of the local media that with all of the building in South End and the closing of a number of other restaurants and venues to make room for new building, was Price's Chicken Coop days number.  I don't know it that is the case but it stuck in my head and when I was in 1st Ward for a meeting at one of the Churches, I made a concerted effort and actually planned out my day to include Price's and I'm glad I did.  Streets area a bit congested with a lot of work being done on the rail line expanding the stations but I was able to find a pretty close parking spot on the street.  Walked in and it was like controlled bedlam. A lot of people waiting but four counters open so the wait was very short.  A brief overview for those who have not been.  It's counter order but you can order ahead but requires 30 minutes for your order. Cash only but ATM close. Take out only and no seating inside or outside either.  That said, I  ordered 1/4 of a 3 1/2 pound Chicken, all white meat Dinner that also included Hushpuppies, Roll, French Fries and Cole Slaw. Tea was extra but all in all a very good value.  Picked up my order in just a couple of minutes and drove back to Cornelius and ate my lunch overlooking Lake Norman.  The Chicken was excellent. Large meaty breast and a wing with a light breading cooked to perfection. The Hush Puppies were good but probably would have been better hot but I got caught in the I-77 Construction Purgatory that all of us in the Northern Part of the County have to deal with.  Roll was good as were the Fries.  The Cole Slaw was pretty good but that that with a grain of salt because I don't normally like Cole Slaw and for me to say it was pretty good is a compliment.  Was it worth the trip,  Definitely yes and I will be back.
Best fried chicken and potato salad in the SOUTH!!!! They are old school so bring cash and get off the phone when ordering...they don't play that

Man this place is so overrated. The gas station on south and east has way better chicken!!  I'm also not a big fan of their potato rounds(the gas station has wedges).  I also feel like I'm in 1950 as the two cashiers are white old ladies and the 7 people sweating in the kitchen are all black.  There is also no dining-in.  Not thats a problem with me, just giving the heads up.

Price's is great because it is a Charlotte legend.  The chicken is greasy, the tea is sweet, and the potatoes come in tot form.  The only draw back here is that they arent open for that many hours and are closed on Mondays (I think on the weekends too).  Price's will always remind me of my elementary school picnics in Latta Park.

Now I can see why there's always a line.  Had my first experience and purchased the 1/4 chicken white meat with hush puppies and taters....the hush puppies were to die for (wish I had gotten extra) and the chicken was still hot, crispy and flavorful by the time I got back to the office...the tater tots, however, were a bit greasy and flavorless and ended up in the trash....but would definitely go again and just substitute all my sides for MORE HUSH PUPPIES!!!!
man, the chicken is damn good here... definitely one of the best fried chicken joints in the country in my book.
On a scale of 1-5 my mother votes 10. Best most generous fish sandwich, got a dozen tasty giant hush puppies for $2!

Their name tells their tale. You come here knowing what you want and if you don't make sure you read the menus that are posted on the windows on the storefront. The cashier/server doesn't have the patience for your cell phone talking or slow-minded decision making. The customers behind you won't have the patience either. Of course I'm talking about their lunch rush. You can go off-peak hours and receive a little more graciousness from everyone.   I usually get the 1/2 chicken combo and call it a day. It'll feed you plenty and probably  someone else if you have a small appetite. Great chicken that doesn't have thick layers of breading. Just enough to give you that crisp crunch before sinking your teeth into the moist seasoned chicken. No greasy aftertaste either. Just simple fried chicken and sides that are plenty enough.  They serve buckets also if you want to come with your family. HOWEVER, do not expect any seating in the place. It's a get your food and get out kind of establishment. You'll usually see business men chomping away next to a construction worker. My kind of place. No fancy decor or titles, just food.   Go here and not KFC, you'll thank them.

I've heard a lot about this place and made a point to try it.  You have to make a point as their hours are quite short in that they close at 6 pm and are not open on Sundays.  It is definitely an experience, especially to be seen.  The restaurant is a carry out only with just a counter and a line of cashiers.  They're all dressed in white, with a slight dusting of flour that has likely wafted through the air.  It looks exactly like a scene out of a 1950's cafeteria.  There's even an overseer, also dressed in white, who fits the bill, older, heavyset gentleman, watching very carefully the ongoings through his black horned rim glasses.  I asked and they told me it's a long lived family business.  Now, I'm not describing this to imply a negative light, but rather it really is an experience to behold that reminds me a lot of small towns in Texas back in the 70's where I grew up.  Now to the food.  If you don't like chicken or chicken parts, you've come to the wrong place.  They're an efficient menu that cooks chicken and chicken accessories many ways as long as it's fried.  It's true southern fried chicken.  I've tried a few other establishments in the fine city of Charlotte to partake in these southern dishes that I aren't quite replicated in Baltimore, and I'll have to say that in my opinion, they won't rank the best chicken for me.  I'd say it's OK.  I found the skin a bit salty to my taste. And it was a bit dry for me.  But in all fairness, I think the place I have in mind which is the best, the chicken is cooked in lard.  Yeah, so there's that.  So, I wouldn't eat lard fried chicken except for once in a blue moon.  I am pretty certain that Price's does not use lard, though I didn't ask, as it would be too expensive for such a large operation.  I would have taken some photos, but there are like 3 signs in the establishment highly suggesting you don't use your cell phones or other electronic devices.  I was scared that I unholstered my iPhone, I'd be run out of there, soup nazi style.  But I checked and there are some photos already for this restaurant that some brave souls took already which I think are descriptive and of the only things you could take:  fried chicken and the ordering counter.  It is certainly better than the chain chicken restaurants.  So, it's good chicken and a sight to behold.

Best fried chicken in town...but, seriously, I can only eat it once every few months.  Let's just say...so much grease and fat, I can actually hear my heart clogging up.  But if you know you're going to need to take a double dose of your cholesterol medication, then it's nothing but good!!!  Also, this is probably the only place in Charlotte that I'd say you WANT to go during the rush of lunch.  There are some true characters both as patrons and employees...go, stand in line, check things out...but be ready to order when you're up!  They will not take any delays so just be prepared.

So, after hearing all the hype about this heaven sent fried chicken, I decided to finally bite the fried bullet and go check out the coop. After walking in and trying to elbow my way into one of the 5 so called lines, I grabbed my 1/4 dark with hush pups and hit the road. Overall, I think nostalgia is what keeps this place going, because the chicken is just okay....nothing better than if you know how to soak a bird in some buttermilk, dredge in seasoned flour and fry. Hush pups were a bit dense and bland...needed some onion bits or something. Anyways, been there and done that, and must say Church's is better.
Price's is a hole in the wall. Takeout only. Fried chicken is the best ever. Worth the trip!

Saw this place had a lot of reviews and I was in the mood for some good southern chicken. Went in, place was packed and smelled great, line was moving along. I was in a hurry and needed something to go so I ordered chicken white meat sandwich. Prices are super cheap although a bit strange to pay per packet of ketchup or hot sauce. Anyways I got on the road and went to take a bite out of it and there were bones! I had never seen a sandwich where they slap pieces of fried chicken bones n all included. Somewhat disappointing as it kind of defeats point of the sandwich.... the chicken was tasty though!

If you haven't been to Price's Chicken Coop, you're missing out on the best fried chicken in Charlotte - this is a fact. Price's has been around probably longer than I have and with good reason. The location is awful but, is it worth it? YES! If you give money to beggars - bring an extra buck or 2 because half the time there's someone just outside asking for money (hey, it's true - I'm not knocking them). You'd think the location would be a deterrent for  your more businessy types but, all walks of life are found at Price's. If you want the best fried food that you've ever put in your face-hole - you can't beat Price's. You can't eat in - it's to go but, I wouldn't dare call it fast food (I also wouldn't dare call it healthy - it's what they call "food for the soul"). PS. my grandma (who has lived in dilworth for longer than I've been alive) says the fried fish at Showmars is better. (Still, the fried chicken is the best).

This is simple: Prices has the best friend chicken on earth. Period. Full stop. End of. I've had fried chicken all over the US and the world, but this is by far the best!  The only knocks I can give Prices is that a) it's cash only; b) it's carry-out only, and there nowhere in the immediate area to eat except your car; c) the side dishes are a bit of an afterthought; and d) there's always a huge line. As others have said, if you don't know what you want, or if you're talking on a cell phone, STEP OUT OF THE LINE so the rest of us can get on with our day.  That said, my tip is this: the most popular lunches are the 1/4 chicken dinners. During the lunch rush, a couple of employees will make these non-stop and stack them up. But sometimes the dinners don't get rotated out properly. The 1/2 chicken dinners are made to order each time, so if you order one of those you're guaranteed that it's fresh and hot.

"What do you mean I can't just buy one leg? I don't want a thigh." 'Have it your way' has yet to arrive at this "Old-South" chicken spot.   After destroying my smack-talking colleague on the tennis court in a late morning match, he cried out for wings. I'm guessing tearing into innocent little pieces of flesh was his way of soothing his ego for failing to dominate me on court. Men.  He ordered 10 wings, and I just wanted one chicken leg. "Ms. Daisy" at the counter wasn't budging, so I instead got 2 wings.   Funny; a few years ago, my sister called me up furious: " Why must I hear from the Food Network that the #1 fried chicken place in the country is right there in Charlotte?! As many times as I've visited!". I had no idea, and hadn't been there, so her next visit, we went. That was about 4 years ago. Hadn't been back since.  It's good chicken. She was satisfied and returned to NYC with bragging rights. We agreed we would not rate it the "best in the country" by any stretch of the imagination. Simple salty fried chicken. Today, the same.

Well worth the extra calories for lunch. The fried chicken is what I went for and I was not disappointed. Ordering was a little confusing but they quickly take your order, give you your drink, it's cash only, and deliver your order in a card board box with everything you need. It was busy at about 12:30 on a Saturday afternoon and they have a ton of staff working to take care of the crowd. I had potato salad and the slaw---they were ok. Mayo based and I prefer vinegar based. No biggie, I wasn't there for the sides. Hush puppies where great. I did get a 1/2 chicken both white and dark meat. It was delish and I think anyone in Charlotte has got to go at least once.  The only thing missing is somewhere to sit, although I wouldn't want to sit inside as anyone sitting inside for an extended amount of time would come out smelling like they were frying the chicken.

Established in 1962, Prices Chicken Coop has been putting out some of the best fried chicken in the South! They are marinated for a day, coated in seasoned flour, and then deep fried in 100% peanut oil.  I ordered a full chicken and let me tell you.. every piece in that box was divine. Crispy, flavorful, and juicy! You know good fried chicken when the breast is super moist and not dry.  There is no seating, but with fried chicken this good, I'd stand all day if need be.  Key Points:  Best damn fried chicken I've ever had. Reasonable prices

Being from New England I knew during my time in the south I would have to try some high quality fried chicken. Price's Chicken Coop was the spot the locals informed me about so I made my way over to give it a try.  I ordered a fried chicken sandwich, which was a large over sized breast served between two slices of bread. Bone and all.  Upon first bite I was in heaven. I had never had southern fried chicken like this before and I thought it was just amazing. Crispy and juicy, cooked to perfection.  The chicken was loaded with flavor and everything about it just tasted amazing. Price's Chicken Coop is worth checking out.

Alright yelpers...my first time visiting since moving to the Queen City, my thoughts are below.   Pros: old school chicken shack, reasonable prices, chicken is fried good but not hard, chicken is yummy, friendly cashiers and is cash only - very easy. Oh sweet tea is definitely south sweet tea.   Cons: wings are smaller than I expected, fries are basic crinkle frozen joints, sweet potatoe pie was ok.   Oh yeah fyi, get in where you fit in when you walk in, find a register and stand in the line.   I was advised by cashier next time I come the fried fish (perch) is most popular!!!

Hands down the fried chicken is cooked to utter perfection, golden brown, juicy, salty, savory and well worth the value, is fries, frozen and simple, hush puppies dry and tasteless, cole slaw, overly tangy and a roll is basically just that, nothing spectacular. BBQ King is better overall and a little more fun to order from. This place is simple and pretty hectic to order from. If you are looking for excellent fried chicken, then this is the place, but if you want an overall excellent meal, it falls short.

Advice - Bring Cash, be prepared to stand in line.  Then get prepared for the best fried chicken of your lifetime.  I am admittedly not born and bred in the South and no one in my family has a clue how to make homemade fried chicken so my experience in life thus far has been buckets of KFC.   KFC doesn't hold a candle to whatever they have going on at Price's, it is certainly a no frills place, it's takeout only, and it's not open on Sunday or Monday.  I have only gotten the quarter chicken white meal for $6.25 with a sweet tea of course, an extra 75 cents.  I can afford that!  The meal comes with the chicken, a roll, the most delicious tater tots in the universe, hush puppies, and some pretty tasty cole slaw.  It is served in a cardboard box that is already greasy when you leave the place.  After you eat you will need a nap and I would suggest only going here once a month at most for fear you will have a heart attack if you frequent it.  But it is so delicious, the chicken is juicy, the outside is crispy, and the sides and sweet tea are amazing.  If you are ever in the South End or Charlotte in general you have to make a stop here!

8 dollars for fried chicken, hush puppies, cole slaw, AND crinkle cut fries?  What a deal.  Don't forget the sweet tea -- sugary, lemony goodness.  My friend got the gizzards and they were good too.  I need to try the sandwich next time.  This is the pinnacle of Southern cuisine.  I don't know who this Price guy is, but I love him.

Great fried chicken at reasonable prices.  I'm not a fried chicken expert, but this place was delicious every time.  I personally Price's more than Sallie Mae's in NOLA (who sometimes gets the "best fried chicken in America" label).  Some details about this place:  - Cash Only - Private parking lot in the back (entrance to parking can be difficult to notice) - Takeout only - Gets crowded, so be ready to order when you get to the front of the line - You can order sweet tea at the counter, for other drinks, there's a soda machine on the side.

I had heard such great things about Price's and we were very excited to go there to eat. I think we had set our standards way too high based on how wonderful we were told it was. It was really good chicken. Not the best. Just good. The potato salad was really weird and I would not recommend that! It was good and I would go there again I'm just not going to proclaim it the best.

I had heard about Price's from several food review websites and food critics. I loooovve Fried Chicken, but I had never had the time to check out this place with school and all that. But in the summer, I started working in uptown so I finally had a chance to check it out. After I ate my 1/4 chicken white tray, instant regret filled my soul. Regret that I had never had this chicken up until now. I've lived in Charlotte my whole life, and to finally have tasted the food of the Gods at 20 years old was a bitter sweet moment. Price's Chicken Coop, you have just gained a new regular. It seriously is so amazing.

The chicken has fallen off! No flavor but was nicely presented. The gizzards were ok fried a little soft. The tea and potato salad was everything. The wait time wasn't bad at all. The pricing is cool but I'd be okay to visit the city and not eat here again.

Chicken is good and so are the tator tots and coleslaw. If you want some greasy fried chicken, the kind that runs down the front of your chin when you bite into it, this is the spot. Chicken is always crispy with good flavor. The coleslaw and potato salad are a must.   Heads up: parking is a headache, they are cash only, and don't step up to the register until you know what you want or you will be told to step out of line while you decide to order (happened to me kind of embarrassing).

This is real "Southern Food"....  A great place to get your fried chicken groove on and is a true institution in Charlotte. This is a great place to go and grab some take out (no dining area) in the heart of Charlotte. Prices will own a place in my heart because it was my  first ever experience with Carolina BBQ. Remembering the chopped pork with the spicy/tangy sauce makes my belly smile at the thought of it. Almost makes me shed a tear in my sweet tea. Which there is none up North with all these Yankees in Boston which is ironic I thought Yankees were from NY? Who knew... So bottom line: drive, bike, run, walk or crawl go to Prices and you will not be sad you did.....

I was so excited to try this place because I've heard such good things about it. I was expecting amazingly flavored chicken fried to perfection.   Was the chicken crispy yes, was the chicken juicy, fresh and tender..yes..... BUT.. It was completely void of flavor.  The only thing I could taste was salt and MSG.  I get horrible reaction from msg but wouldn't ever eat this chicken again even if it didn't have any in it.    Out of all the hood famous chicken spots this is the worst one.  Churches, chicken box and nana's soul food kitchen is WAY better. Popeyes in my opinion is even better.  I would even go to bojangels before coming here.  I gave it 2 stars because everyone was so nice when I was picking up the food.  I just can't believe this is the chicken spot that everyone talks about. I'm in disbelief:/

The other reviews for this place are really spot on. Cash only. No seating. Take out only. Be prepared with what you want (kind of feels like the soup nazi a little bit, and I am slow to make decisions - panic mode!). But it's pretty darn good.  The chicken is fresh and crispy. I had the 1/4 chicken dark meat meal. Really good chicken. They don't do fake/over processed  chicken, no boneless anything. And when we asked the lady at the register if they did chicken strips, she smiled and said, "no, baby, this is real thing only."  Perfect response.  I'll definitely come back here, with a little blanket to sit on the grass.

Best fried chicken I have ever had, period. The skin is just right, crispy, without being overly greasy. Price's must have their own private supply of special, meaty chickens...I always feel like their full chicken meal is one of the best deals in Charlotte. Give them a try (bring cash - no credit cards) - if you like fried chicken, you will love Price's.

Old fashioned Fried chicken and tots. Sure they have a few other items such as fish and such, but go to Price's for the legendary fried chicken.   It is take out only and there is always a line but it moves quickly. Be ready when it is your turn. The staff can be friendly or abrupt depending on who you get and how busy they are.

Great chicken. You're going to need to have cash because it being 2017 doesn't mean anything to this place. Only takes cash. But that's ok, because they have an ATM inside. They are closed on mondays.

I've lived in Charlotte 13 years, and I JUST made it to Price's. After all the hype I've heard, I've gotta say, I was a little let down. I mean, it was fine... but just fine.  The fella and I stopped in on a Saturday around 5:00 (they close at 6:00), and the place was fairly busy. We both got the 1/4 white chicken dinner, and the lady behind the counter was really friendly and helpful. It's probably good to know what you want when you go in there because there's a lot of hustle and bustle, and it could be a little overwhelming.  Since there's nowhere to sit, we walked back to our truck and popped out the tailgate - a pretty fun afternoon picnic! There were people sitting across the street in the grass, too.   So, the chicken was okay, but mine was a little dry. The tater tots were really good, but if you'd given me Bo Rounds, I'm not sure I could've told the difference. The hush puppies were pretty delicious, and I'm not a slaw eater, so I skipped that.  The fella is a slaw aficionado, and he said it was just ok - nothing to write home about. I got excited thinking the roll was one of those tasty yeast rolls, but it was pretty tasteless.  Overall, I was pretty underwhelmed. Maybe my expectations were too high or maybe it was an off day for them or maybe their reputation is better than their food.
Here's my review of Price's Chicken: yum! yum! yum! yum! yum! yum! yum! yum!   Catch my drift?

Best Fried Chicken Ever. Several national "chicken" articles have said so, and so do I.   Not much else to write, so I will provide you some rules about getting your food from Price's.  1) Bring Cash- No Credit, No Debit, No Checks, and No ATM nearby.  2) Don't Go on Sunday or Monday- they are closed.  3) Don't' be late. When they say they close at 6pm, they mean 6pm.  4) Don't talk on the Cell Phone when ordering- or you wont be ordering.  5)You don't eat AT Price's- there is nowhere to sit.  6) Don't bite into the chicken sandwich. It is a Price's tradition- your chicken still has the bones, even on the sandwich.   Last but not least, ENJOY the taste, the smell, and the atmosphere of this one-of-a-kind chicken joint!

As far as fried chicken goes, you probably can't find any better in Charlotte area.  It's amazing... Personally I would like it a bit spicier but nothing some hot sauce can't fix.  Cash only... take out only.  Very good good.

If you're within two blocks of this landmark restaurant, it's likely that you're being lured in by the smell of tasty fried chicken. The lines can be long and overwhelming, particularly on sweltering summer days, but once you get your cardboard box filled with fried chicken and sides, it's worth it.   Know what you want before you get up to the counter and have cash ready. They don't take plastic. Also, there's no where to eat at Price's. You'll likely be tempted to start eating the greasy meal in your car.

Best chicken I have ever had! Giving 4 stars just because they didn't allow substitutions and because they don't have a place to sit to eat. Other than that you really have to try this chicken.  Customer Service: Well they were packed so I understand that they can't stop and be super friendly but it was nice.

Fried Gizzards.  Forget the chicken.  As an undercover Southerner, I was giddy with excitement that Price's had that rare bit of fried offal.  Like little chunks of deep fried erasers, gizzards don't really have any flavor, but a chewy rubbery texture.  At Price's, they're not bad, but not great either.  Which kinda sums up the rest of my experience.     Located in an up-and-coming area of Charlotte, Price's Chicken Coop stands out among all the hipster-ish boutiques popping up.  The shop was bustling when we arrived - people were coming in and out with white boxes.    I wanted to love Price's.  I read most of the yelp reviews - the good and the bad and played Russian Roulette with my stomach.  I lost.    The smallest portion size, which is 1/4 of the bird, or about four pieces, is enough for two people.  Coleslaw was forgettable and the tator tots were lukewarm.  The breading (the most critical part) was flavorless with no seasoning or salt.

This is one of the last true little gems of South End that show us a glimpse into what the area used to be like. A little piece of history!   I walk there on the rail trail from my apartment. At lunch time this place is buzzing! You walk in and there is a large counter with about 8 people behind it all busy working. I think the term 'organized chaos' was invented in this little mom n' pop!   The menu is above the counter and read it quickly because the line moves fast. There are different combinations of dark meant, white meat and wings. The have fries, cole slaw, and hushpuppies. The soda machine is stocked with Cheerwine!  The women that tend the counter are the sweetest! You'll probably be called "babydoll" or "sweetpie" :)  There's no seating, so your only option is to take it to go! Perfect picnic food. Don't be alarmed if you see people eating out of their boxes while walking down the street... they can't wait to dig in sometimes!  Please continue to support this wonderful little establishment! And don't use your cell phone at the counter -- you've been warned!

Heard so much about this place that I just had to give it a shot. They run a pretty efficient business over there. Been twice for take-out and was in and out in under five minutes both times. So here's the skinny:  The prices are ridiculous (in a good way). All that food and I never spend more than 8 bucks. Then again, not like this stuff is good for you. Oh how I wish it was. Anyway, the chicken is good--definitely doesn't match the hype but it hits the spot. Doesn't seem like it's seasoned with anything beyond salt (and it is quite salty) but it's fried to perfection, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  Sides were disappointing. Potato salad was blah and hush puppies were decent at best. Iced tea, however, made up for it. Wish they came in different sized cups other than standard so I could order the super size. Best fried chicken in the Charlotte area? I'm not convinced but it's pretty high up there.

I loveeeee the Chicken Coop!! As a Charlotte native, I grew up with this place and loved when my parents came home with those easy-to-recognize boxes! My last trip to the Coop was as good as always - great chicken livers and great fried chicken. BUT I was seriously SO sad to find out that they have stopped making tater tots!! They only have fries now. If you're reading this, Chicken Coop, please bring back the tots, please!!!

I have to say I agree with the masses this place is good stuff.  This was my first time trying Prices even though ive been in the neighborhood for about half a year. I kept hearing about how delicious it is so I finally made it in and yep everyone was right it is fried and tasty wonderfulness. This place could fry a cell phone and I'd probably eat it.   I didn't go with the usual and get the chicken my guy and I opted for the fish that day. It came with a pile of tator tots and 2 fluffy hush puppies potato salad and a tiny side of tartar sauce. I only wish the fish pieces had been a little larger but taste good they sure did.   I bet the chicken is really where its at and I look forward to returning to give it a go real soon. Parking isn't to bad but lunch is really busy there they move people in and out with ease but be prepared to eat your food on the sidewalk outside by the train track which to me only adds to the charm of the place. Be sure to stop in for some great lunch if your in the mood for fried goodness.
Still in love with the "Coop" after all these years. Chicken fried simple.... Boo to the fact that they have switched from tater tots to crinkle cut fries. At least let me have a choice.

Best fried chicken I've ever had. A Charlotte landmark, you must go here. They give you so many sides - hush puppies, tater tots, coleslaw and a roll - that my fiance and I get the half a chicken, white and it's more than enough food. 2 breasts and 2 wings with all those sides. $10! It's a deal and worth every calorie. Eat outside on the grass by the light rail, makes for a great Saturday lunch! Oh and we just bring water with us. There's also fresh tea and a soda machine if you want a soda. Make sure you bring cash! Cash only!

A fun drive by adventure while passing through Charlotte. The handy tip from our cashier to take our boxes to a lovely neighborhood park around the block for a picnic dinner was what really made the experience... you don't have to eat on the trunk of your car!!!!

Quintessential local spot for fried chicken and every good thing you've heard about it true. They fry chicken and they fry it well. I get the 3 wing sandwich. Why do they put it in a bun? Who cares? The chicken is HOT and seasoned to perfection. They close early evening, so this a not a place to go to 'for dinner' . When you go, bring CASH, get ready to stand ( but not for long) and they prefer you NOT use your cellphone while waiting :-).

I don't see what all the hoopla is about. I've had better fried chicken. But it's still pretty god.  Cash only is kinda annoying as is the lack of parking. But you get your food pretty quick. It's mostly a locals joint - so they take orders pretty quickly too.  dark chicken is best

I don't eat meat, but I eat at Price's for the sheer anti-glamour. Their potato salad is other chicken fixin's remind me of eating at my mom's church on a Sunday afternoon. It might not be great for a pickier vegetarian, but I've made many a meal out of potato salad and slaw and the greasy glow of lips of my loved ones. It's worth going just to see what the hype's all about.

I had the dinner combo of fried chicken wings, which came with cole slaw, tater rounds, hushpuppies, and a roll.  The chicken wings had a nice crispy skin and was great with a dash of hot sauce.  I loved how they served round tator tots on the side.  We found a space a few blocks away and ate outside as this is more of a take-out.  The chicken is fried in peanut oil, and it's a pretty solid chicken place to check out.  +round tator tots +fried chicken wings

My friend has talked about Price's chicken coop since I met him. In 11 years I was told about this place so when I finally made it to charlotte I had to check this place out. I thought I was going to be walking into a little mom and pop restaurant where I would be one of a few people .... I pulled up and the line was out the door  the street parking was full and I found a parking lot behind the building. I walked up hoping to get out of the heat and I had to slither in bc the room was full everyone was elbow to elbow and of course it was hotter than Hades inside too... i had no intention of getting the sweet tea bc I was told it was really sweet and all I pictures were my teeth burning bc it was too sweet... I was so parched I had no choice but to order the tea... it was delicious ! Perfect Southern Sweet Tea ... I ordered a whole chicken and when I got to the car I unveiled THEEE most beautiful golden bird pieces. I think it was anointed. It was hot and I burned my fingerprints off but that didn't stop me from enjoying the best fried chicken I had in my entire life. Oh the service was good too and it was quick but my goodness I can't wait to go back- I hope they don't relocate - this chicken is amazing and it needs to be a landmark
Chicken was hot and juicy but lacked flavor -- nothing special. Tea and sides were OK.  Must be a local legend but not nearly as good as the hype.

I love Price's Chicken Coop! CASH ONLY though!!! Go at 11:30 AM and a Saturday and you usually won't have to wait. Other than that you are probably going to have to wait. There is no messing around here - pick a line quickly and know what you want and be fast about it. I have been here when fights have broken out and the cops were called. Just don't screw around and cut in line and you will be fine. I always get the half chicken white or dark (comes with hush puppies - so good and tater tots). It also comes with a side like coleslaw which I swap out for the potato salad. The coleslaw has a weird after taste or something. Get the fried apple pie too near the register - yum!

Not sure what the hubbub is about this place so took the fam to check it out....ummm big mistake.  Chicken is way to greasy and really wasn't that flavorful.  Give me Popeyes or KFC or heck even Bo', over it.  Sides were not to good either.  if you must go for the experience of it, then shoot, go for it, but I doubt you'll go back again.

Best fried chicken I have had so far. All pieces white and dark were moist  and juicy. Wonderful coating, crispy not crunchy.  Not overly salty but just right. Take out only,  no tables. We sat in our car in the parking lot behind their store eating  our chicken.. I also ordered coleslaw, nothing special but the fried chicken is the queen in the queen city!
Best chicken in Charlotte. Ordering is easy, if you don't know what you want yet, don't go up to the counter. Cash only. Just get the chicken. You'll love it.

Way back when I was visitng Charlotte for the first time I remember driving by this little place with a line out the door.  People used to rush out and start devouring their food immediately.  On nice days there would be people sitting on the curbs, boxes on hoods of cars or simply folks walking down the street stuffing their face.  And yes - i was one of those people.  Price's is a charlotte insitution and worth a trip if you are in town and like fried chicken.  If not ..i feel bad for you depriving yourself of one of lifes pleasures but oh well ...

Big buildup..BIG LETDOWN.   Placed was packed at lunchtime. I didn't mind the wait for this supposedly legendary fried chicken. Ordered a whole fried mixed pieces box and the iced tea too.  As soon as I bit into it in the truck my WTF alert and gag reflex met each other and shook hands. You can get this exact bland, semi dry chicken in any part of the ghetto in the Bronx! Come on! This is overpriced garbage. Threw it all away.   I've had legendary fried chicken in Charlotte before. Anyone remembers how the Coffee Cup used to fry chicken?   Their sweet tea was nice...but the tea flavor is nearly drowned out by the waaay too excessive sugar used.  Fly by this coop. It's a sad commentary that so many rave about substandard fare when Coffee Cup should've left an indelible memory.

The chicken at this place will haunt my dreams.   Two boxes of **incredible** fried chicken, a couple of generous sides, and sweet tea for just $33 -- when I tell people about this back in San Francisco, they may never speak to me again.   What a find! I'll be back later this summer for sure.

Price's is the best fried chicken I have had down here in Charlotte thus far! I love how quick the service is. Not very convenient that its cash only but there is an ATM inside. I find it humorous that you get a package of ketchup attached to your fork by way of a rubber band. This is no four start establishment, far from it, but the chicken and the price is worth returning.
A smidgen above Average at best. Have no idea why this is continuously hyped. Don't get me wrong it's good but it's not all what everyone makes it out to be.

This place is old school... southern fried chicken dinner in a box.  To go only.  Cash only.  It is a classic Charlotte place and was very tasty.  Mixed (white/dark) chicken dinner (fries, hush puppies, slaw and a roll).  Find a table outdoors and get a sweet tea (I prefer unsweetened, but this meal calls for sweet tea).  I'm taking off one star as the oil my chicken was fried in was a bit old on my visit, giving a slight burnt taste, but still a great experience.
This had been hyped up so much that it couldn't live up to what they said. I found it a bit on the dry side and the sides were nothing to write home about. Don't think I will bother again.

I'd heard about this place but had never really looked it up or found it.  Since we were in Charlotte for the day I decided to find it and check it out.  It wasn't too far from the South Park area where we were staying so we hit it for lunch.  I'm a big fried chicken fan and I like to try out the chicken at most restaurants and buffets in the area if I have a chance.  My brother-in-law had told me he had gone here and really lied it.  It's strictly carry-out..no tables, no parking.  You have to park on the street.   Unfortunately we didn't order a dinner so I didn't get to try any of the sides...we only wanted to try their chicken.  My wife and I both ordered a breast and wing.  I had a sweet tea.  The chicken is as good as most of the people say.  Nice and juicy, crisp skin.  Since we didn't order a dinner they gave it to us wrapped up in a thin paper and a lot of napkins.  I would say it's some of the best chicken that I've tasted....not the best.  The best chicken I've had in South Carolina is Bernie's in Columbia.  This would run a close second with Shealy's Buffet in Batesville-Leesburg area.  I'd like to go back and try a dinner next time..  Highly recommend the chicken though.  Cash only...no credit cards.

I decided to come here the first weekend when I moved down to Charlotte in September.  Absolutely the BEST FRIED CHICKEN I've ever had.  Luckily, I located this small, hidden gem situated in South End on the first shot.   Coming from the north, there's not much options out there besides your typical KFC and Popeyes.  And to be quite frank, I am not usually a huge "Fried Food Person", but I swear there is something special that Price's does to their chicken.  Whether its injecting it with some type of marinade or coating the entire batch with crack, every bite is memorable.  Juicy inside and fried to the perfect crisp.     Now lets talk about the service.  I have to admit...first time coming in with no cash, I was chewed out from one of the old southerners in the front counter.  Make sure you bring cash!  And make sure you withdraw your money quick, otherwise you will be the last in line (high customer flow).        Overall, Price's Chicken Coop is a one-of-a-kind hole in the wall with a mix of a NYC attitude/service.  Their quick and get to the point.  Best of all, the food is amazing.    P.S: Don't forget to buy their legendary sweet tea.  It's a perfect compliment with the meal after downing all that grease and delicious goodness.
Amazing chicken. Ah-maz-zing. The tots were just a tad overcooked fir my liking. Cole slaw was bomb.com. Definitely coming back and recommending to friends and family.

I was pumped to go get some fried chicken after hearing raving reviews about this place. Due to the awesome prices I couldn't resist just getting a whole dark chicken. The whole experience was pretty quick with minimal waiting time. Had to rummage up the dollars I had in my wallet since it was cash only. Luckily had a few dollars left over to help out my friend.   The box was filled and the chicken smelled delicious. If only it tasted that way. There was an odd taste to the chicken which was almost like soap. It wasn't a deal breaker and was still edible, but that wasn't the only problem. The chicken first of all is way to bland, where is the flavor! Secondly, it tasted like it was probably left out for a while. I heard some people complain that it was too greasy, but I don't mind me so artery clogging liquid. The chicken king right down the street from me is a much better choice. Popeye's is still leagues above this. Maybe I'll give it another shot due to its reputation, but I don't have high hopes.

I was pretty underwhelmed with the chicken. Super friendly staff and the price isn't bad but the chicken was nothing to write home about.   I will say it wasn't BAD and for the price I really have no complaints. It just didn't live up to the hype for me. I got the dark meat combo and the chicken was borderline dry! Only thing I thought was excellent was the sweet tea. Maybe the best I've ever had and I'm not even a sweet tea fan!

OH! MY! GAWD! BEST DAMN CHICKEN E-V-E-R!  I used to live here in Charlotte but now I live in California. It was just as good as I remembered it!  Yuuuuuuuuuuuummy! And I met the nicest lady you'd ever want to meet in your life. She was so sweet to me when she was taking my order. Her name was Johnsiner and I can't remember the last time I met anybody that friendly. Everybody was really, really nice that worked there.  But OH! MY! GAWD! That chicken! It's like eating Heaven!

As old school fried chicken as it gets! Price's Chicken Coup is just a plain, simple, old as the city itself, brick store front that does fried chicken to perfection! You walk in to a counter top with ladies waiting to take your order, and you better be ready! Like the Seinfeld Soup Nazi, the line backs up quick, and they expect you to order quickly! Fried chicken served white or dark, whole or half bird, and there's shrimp and gizzards too! Sides of hush puppies and tater tots are offered, and like everything else it's fried! The batter is extremely light, which lets the juicy flavor shine throughout! There's no tables to sit down, and as you get your plain white cake box with your chicken inside, you realize your looking for a grassy spot somewhere to eat like your homeless!

The chicken must not be very good. I parked in their lot after hours to visit a nearby food truck rally. Apparently between the poor lighting and overgrown bushes I missed the tiny "no parking" signs. I returned to find my car booted and had to pay $50 to the Price's owner who was nearby grinning. I guess he thought it was a great way to try and shut down the food trucks. Never going here.

Best fish sandwich in Charlotte. They are nickel and dimey but the food is inexpensive so it's not a big deal. I love the potato salad. Reminds me of family cookouts. The slaw isn't anything super special but it is fresh. I've actually never had the chicken. I'm going to assume it's amazing just based on how good the fish is.

Ordered the fried fish sandwich and it was good. Only reason I'm rating 4 stars is because they don't accept card payments, which resulted in me having to pay 2.75 to take cash out from their ATM. Aside from that I wod definitely go again to check out those wings. Ill just make sure to take a 20 from my bank's ATM next time.
Coming from the West Coast, I've never had fried chicken like this in my life! This place is Epic to say the least! Amazing!

I finally made it here in early May after a year of folks telling me to try the best chicken in the south.  No seats, long lines, cash only, don't use your cell phone inside, "special orders do upset us" plus a 20 minute line wait and then I was treated to the absolute best fried chicken I have ever eaten.  This is a must do place.

This is about the best friend chicken you can find.  I think they brine the chicken first, because it's got a salty flavor. Chicken was crunchy.  Hush puppies were to die for.  Really good.    PS - Bring cash.

When the Carolina Panthers first began and an enormous stadium was opening within walking distance, people asked them will they open on Sundays.  They said no.  When the whole world started using debit cards, people asked them will they start using them?  They said no.  When drive throughs took over, would they...?  No.  How about speeding up your cook time?  No.  You could cook faster at a higher temperature.  No.  How about delivery?  No.  How about expanding?  No.  What about a new swanky building near the fancy condos?  No.  How about new uniforms that aren't from Mayberry RFD?  No.  And on and on and on.  This may be the very last truly authentic place left on earth.  The fact that their chicken is 'Price'less is poetic.  I truly applaud them on all counts.  They deserve every accolade they get.
ok y'all i kid you not i am in love with this place. don't even read the rest of my review, just go before 6pm with some dolla bills and get you some good chicken

I headed to Price's a few Saturdays ago after visiting Campbell's Nursery on South Blvd. I picked up two whole fried chickens, three dozen hushpuppies (on a whim, what was I thinking?) and a sweet tea. Total less than $30. The counter man teased me about my hand motions when ordering the tea -- i couldn't decide on a cup or a 1/2 gallon.  The atmosphere of this place is worth almost as much as the chicken.  ALMOST. I love parking on the street, standing in line, hearing them yell "Two Birds!", and getting my fresh white box of chicken with grease stains. It's an experience.  But better than the experience is the delicious crispiness of the chicken, so juicy on the inside. It can't be beat in Charlotte, as far as I can tell.   I put my chickens in their boxes in a cooler and drove out to northern Union County, where I dropped one of with a friend and carried the other to another friend's house. We had friend chicken for a late lunch, still warm and crispy, with my friend's farm-canned green beans. I drank that cup of lemony sweet tea before I'd made it out to where Albemarle Road meets Lawyers Road, and it was delicious. A rare treat for me.  Eat Price's chicken every chance you get, but go to the counter and get it yourself for the full experience!

Service was great. I went around 3:00 to miss the traffic. The chicken is good for takeout spot. i prefer there chicken over KFC, and pop-eyes, or NYC crown or Kennedy's . The tater tots where cold, nothing special, Cole slaw good, and hush puppies are good. Sweet tea is done right. The Chicken greatest quality is the flakiness.

If you visit Charlotte are live here you have to try it , its a famous spot. The chicken is good and services very fast. But I dont think its the best fried chicken in CHLT....that goes to the Chicken box

The owner of this place is the Soup Natzi from Steinfield. He SAYS GUARANTEED on his website but he doesn't even try to honor it. I guess this is what happens once Triple D show comes to an establishment. Look what happened to the Penguin.

Price's may just be the best lunch value in Charlotte. Eight bucks bought me a lunch plate piled with a juicy pair of chicken wings, hush puppies and fries. Is it the best fried chicken in the South? How the hell should I know? But it's damn good food, and a local institution that'll kept you coming back again and again.

I really like their fish sandwiches, I also love their sweet tea, and I am obsessed with their pound cake. Everything else I think you're just ok but those items you won't be sorry that you got i promise!

This place is probably going to give me high cholesterol, but who cares, the fried chicken is just about the best I've ever had. It is crunchy while still being tender and juicy.   This placed is TAKE OUT ONLY, which is fine. Lines get a little long but they are pretty good at getting people in and out. Also, try to know what you want before you get to the counter. It can get a bit overwhelming trying to read the menu and decide what you want while you have 20 people waiting behind you. Oh yeah, CASH ONLY!  The sweet tea is PHENOMENAL. I can't even put to words how good it is. In fact, it's actually ruined sweet tea for me -- anytime I have sweet tea all my mind can process is how it's not even close to being as good as the sweet tea at Price's.  The missing *star* is for the fact that the sides are just OK, nothing out of this world.  This place is a MUST GO to, if you are in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Quick service and authentic fried chicken, but I wasn't completely blown away.  As the other reviews have said:  1) It's cash only.  They do have an ATM. 2) It's carry out only.  They were kind enough to recommend a park (Latta Park) down the street about 6 blocks east, and clearly we weren't the only ones that thought it was a good idea, because we saw at least 3 other people at that park with Price's boxes.    The chicken was tasty, and the sides were good.  Better than Bojangles, but not the most incredible chicken I've ever had or anything.
They have the best fried chicken, period. Old-school, cash only take-out place where you have to go to the vending machine if you want a soda. Totally worth the long lines.

I don't know why everyone wets their pants over this place. It's okay but nothing to get excited about.   The chicken pieces are small and blandly seasoned. I think Bojangles chicken is better in both taste and size. I do like the potato rounds (they give you a ton), and the hush puppies are very good with an onion-y flavor. I don't eat coleslaw but my husband does and he says it's downright awful. He throws it out every time. We've gone there maybe 5-6 times and each time I'm left wondering what the rest of Charlotte sees and tastes that I'm not getting.   To be fair, my husband disagrees with my post and says he'd give them 4 out of 5 stars. He loves their chicken. Go figure!

After reading an article about Price's in the now defunct Gourmet mag ... RIP :-( which said Price's is the best fried chicken in The South. Since fried chicken's home is in the The South, that means it's the best fried chicken in the country and by default the world. So damn. Unassuming Price's Chicken Coop, in my boyfriend's hometown, the best in the world? And why havent we gone here yet? Seriously it seems like we never got the chance while in town. But this year FINALLY, we tried it.  3 hungry guys and I .. open saturday afternoon.. there. Pulled up to the line coming out the door. I knew there was no seating but was still thought it funny to see all kinds of people outside on the sidewalk, across the street on the grass next to train tracks, in cars just chowing down. They couldn't wait. More good signs. And although the line was long we were literally in and out with 4 mixed piece dinners in 10 minutes. extra 5 cents for some Texas Pete hot sauce packets no prob. With my first Cheerwine in hand, we made our way to the steps of the builoding next door. Hush puppies .. best ever we all agreed, little tater tots .. bonus.. soft roll .. for me unnecessary so I passed it down, cole slaw was forgettable but cut through all the friedness, but the chicken was the best I ever had on par with my late great-grandmother's. One person in the group disagreed because he favors Dion's in the Keys (but he only eats it when he's drunk :-) sooo .. juicy & perfectly seasoned and a HUGE portion. Best Ever. Will stop by every time I pass through Charlotte for sure.   OH & CASH ONLY!!

I love fried chicken. I love it, especially the wings. So when I heard about Price's slap your momma goodness, I was psyched to try it out.  Ok, $12 for just the bird seemed a bit pricey, but they're independently owned, so I overlooked it. Bojangles has a lot more wiggle room in pricing, because of the sheer volume.  What I couldn't overlook, at the end of dinner, was that it didn't taste better than Bojangles. Now, I do love Bojangles, but I hoped since I was paying more for somewhat home-cooked taste that Price's would be worth the price. It was not. Not bad, just not super-dope-crazy special--no matter what your hipster friends tell you.

Love love  their chicken!  I am sooo glad I don't live in Charlotte!  I would be eating here all the time.  So far I have only had their chicken but their shrimp looked really good too.  They could keep their sides.  Potatoes gave their lives for nothing.  Next time we are going to get a whole chicken so we can have leftovers.

The best fried chicken you can get when you're in Charlotte! CASH ONLY! Great crunchy skin and the flavor and taste is very savory. Great seasoning and moist in the inside. Better than the gas station fried chicken that everyone talks about. Website shows only quarter chicken dinners but the menu on site has half dark chicken meals too. I would suggest to share one chicken dinner with 2 people since it comes with plenty of sides. Out of all the sides, the fries and potato salad are my favorite. The 1/4 chicken sandwiches are literally 2 pieces of chicken in a bun which is plenty if you're not that hungry. The fish sandwich with tartar sauce is also very satisfying. Get the large sweet tea cuz it's so good!! Got the sweet potato pie by the cashier too. It was good and sweet but a little too greasy for me. Overall, a must stop when in Charlotte!

Price's Chicken Coop garners three stars for the overall local experience, however, it would be a must do if it did not cut corners by serving Sara Lee's prepacked pecan pie or Costco style bulk buy rolls, instead of homemade biscuits - this is a chicken restaurant and biscuits are a staple with ones chicken dinner in the South, so I'm told.  The multiple chicken dinner offerings are served in square cardboard boxes, similar to small pizza boxes and no dining room or washrooms are available, so plan on bringing some wipes or making a trip to a local gas station to wash up after you chicken lunch. Although I was not aware of this when we arrived, I opted for a chicken sandwich, for minimal mess, however, the sandwich consisted of boned chicken in between two pieces of bread, so I still had to gnaw on the chicken pieces. The chicken itself was prepared well, in that it did not have an overly greasy aftertaste. The sides, which included Burger Kingesque style hash brown rounds and hushpuppies were fine too.   Price's Chicken Coop is a area instutution in Charlotte and should be visited when looking for local attractions.  Parking is available in a back lot as street parking is limited to 20 minutes.

Ok.....I am a born & bred SOUTHERNER.  Child, I don't understand this overpriced place, nor the hype and high praise. While on assignment in Charlotte, my sorority sister said we had to go so we went. I had a 2piece white, the sides that are mandatory and included, a shrimp add-on and no tea. Yes, I'm a southerner that truly doesn't drink tea.   Picture this: it's 1957 and all that entails. Meaning no credit/debit cards. Pedestrians are everywhere (and I feel we should be more pedestrian-friendly in the south). No inside dining. The price boards written during this year are still posted in April of 2011. Just as the fifties, the black people work the kitchen and in the back while the white folks work the register. Chicken is being cooked for eight hours straight and will be placed on a plate and served in a white box. The ladies place bread and sides in the white box before its passed to the front.   Zoom to my visit on April 21, 2011; and I had no concept of how this place operates except for other great Yelpers telling us to bring cash & how we wont be able to sit inside. The tater tots were old and I'd prefer fries, I didn't get the whole hushpuppy thing but knew to expect it from Yelp. Think I ain't country? Thank the Lord I was in my flatbed so I was considering sitting on the tailgate and eating but I am a lady so shame forced me to move around. I ate it in the parking lot of a restaurant in the Woodlawn area, I think Zack 's. Anywhoo, chicken lacked seasoning and I gave consideration that I am from Louisiana so we believe in seasoning.  Yet, places in Madison, WI have done better. My chicken was older and luke warm. Bashfully saying: BoJangles is better and thats not saying much. Let me close.

Price's Chicken POOP. Yes, you read that correctly.   POOP due to the poopy (not the word I really want to use) service that me and my 66 yrs old mother and I received on 05/12/2018 (Saturday) around 5:00 pm.   We were in line waiting to be helped. Unfortunately, we got into the wrong line waiting to be served by a short lady with orangish-pinkish skin wearing a  black scarf on her head. After waiting awhile, we found out that the server was extremely slow and unorganized. She took several orders but was not fulfilling the orders which slowed down her line. Instead of taking maybe three orders, fulfilling them, and then move onto the next customers, this fool took about 8 orders in a row without fulfilling them. So when me and my mom got  to the front of the line she was trying to fulfill several orders but she was having a problem reading her own handwriting to know what the previous customers  ordered. Smh. The customers behind me were also upset because they also waited for awhile. My mom asked her if we should go into another line if she was extremely busy and she shrugged her shoulders like a child and said, "If you want". We were in line for 10 - 12 minutes at the point. No accommodations were made after waiting for so long. We told a manager what occurred and he was immediately trying to defend the sorry server without investigating what happened.  He attempted to take our order (with some hesitation)but me and my mom were over it and  decided to leave. No need to patronize a business with poor customer service. Plus! I didn't really need the grease anyway. Sign from God?    I use to go to this place several times during the Summer when I visited Charlotte starting as a child (80's).  I had very good memories of this place until now. I was visiting from out of town recently hoping to revisit a good childhood memory and that was no longer the case. Although I am not a Charlotte native, my family members are true natives, born and raised. I was warned not to go there because "things have changed" but I wanted to go anyway. I should have listened because things have definitely changed, especially the staff. In the good ol'days you could expect expedient service where the servers had pride in thier jobs.  This didn't happen with the orangish-pinkish skin lady or her manager as they both seem to be incompetent. The people that really know Price's knows how it used to be. They want to run the business in an old fashioned way (no credit/debit cards, black cooks) but not have the old fashioned, good customer service to go along with it. Overall, I was very disappointed and needless to say...farewell Price's...I will never return. Poopy service is just not my thing.  Good luck to your future.

My boyfriend and I entered the place, and made the mistake of taking 30 seconds to check out the menu. Of course, in that time, multiple lines had formed and we had to stake a place real fast.   We ordered a 1/2 Chicken (dark meat) dinner box, and a 1/4 Chicken (white meat) dinner box. After getting our food, we headed to the car and started scarfing everything down (along with other people doing the same thing).   Roll (Merita) -- nothing special. Cole slaw -- all right. Tater rounds (a ton) -- defrosted from a bag. Hushpuppies -- homemade and delicious, BUT we only got 2 single hushpuppies (a sin!). This chicken was so good that I was sucking the chicken bones that my boyfriend had already finished off. I have no shame.  We were full, but still had cravings and were about to go back in and get more. Fortunately, we had restraint -- but we did lustfully look back at the 1/4 Chicken box that was reserved for my boyfriend's mom. (We were good, and fought off the thoughts of substituting KFC in exchange for this heavenly, Southern manna).  ***Skip the dinner box and get a whole chicken! Oh, and get an order or 2 of hushpuppies!

Got there with 8 minutes to spare before closing.  Two men were standing at the front door like body guards, telling us to hurry up and come in if we were going to order.  I ordered, was immediately told they were out of dark meat, then told that dark meat was available.  I confirmed that I wanted a dinner and no sweet tea.  A few sides were listed and I had trouble understanding if I was supposed to choose from the sides and what exactly the options were.  A very annoyed cashier eventually made me understand that my dinner comes will all of the things she listed.  No, biscuits are not a thing here.    I was devastated to find that tater tots are no longer being offered.  Everyone's meal photos with the tots looked so great.  The fries were just ok.  I like mine soggy, not crispy, so these school-cafeteria style fries were better than homefries or anything like that, but more mushy than limp so not exactly my cup of tea.  They were plenty salted though!  Honestly, I'd have much preferred sweet potato fries or criss-cross waffle-cut fries, but with 6 minutes to go, beggars can't be choosers.    I liked that there was a pickle slice on my coleslaw but the slaw was too tangy for me.  I ate the pickle though!  The roll was generic but the hush puppies smelled and tasted like onion--I really liked that!!!  My dark meat included one surprisingly small drumstick, one nice sized thigh, and a small thigh.  Definitely preferable to a wing, so thank you for that!  My box opened directly onto a baby fork wrapped with a single ketchup packet and a salt packet (totally unnecessary) atop a napkin the size of the box which was already fairly saturated with oil and coleslaw juice.  We found a nearby rail line set of chairs and scarfed--it was delicious (as we were to the bugs, we soon found out).  Glad we ate it hot and fresh.  I'm not sure what reheated chicken would have been like, given the soft texture of the breading.  I really did find it juicy and delicious, but I'm not ready to call this the best in Charlotte.  I haven't found anything better, but I'm new so I'm not going to jump to conclusions.  Maybe next time I'll try them earlier in the day and see if that makes a difference.  I've been trying to track my finances better and since this was cash, I wish I would have gotten a receipt or a price marked on the box cover, as I don't remember the actual price paid.  Somewhere in the $7 range, but what I remember is more than any of the current photos+tax should be so I'm not totally sure.

You can't beat the chicken here! It's a legend in the Charlotte area. Cash only, not a lot of choices. The choices thing down at bother me since there's not a bad choice you could make here. Their homemade sweat tea is AHHHHMMAZING.

Worth the hype? Absolutely. We ordered a whole chicken mixed, tater tots, slaw, rolls, and tea. Between the two of us we destroyed it all. Is it greasy? It sure is but in a good way. The meat is juicy and flavorful all the way to the bone. It was ridiculously crowded but still got in and out in under 5 minutes. Some reviewers are going to be pissy about anything but I felt it was worth the drive. We'll definitely be back and next time we're getting some fish and shrimp.

Today our business needed some food for some good ole' southern boys who enjoy chicken.....So, when they say chicken, there's only one place to go - Price's Chicken Coop.  So what do you feed a bunch of guys......10 Full birds, add a few tater tots, and you have a party.  ( I have added photos)  Sure the parking is a little skimpy, sure the place has no tables, sure the place has a no cell phone etiquette policy (which is nice, just look for the signs), sure this is standing room only place, but this place KNOWS chicken. This place has the business plan to succeed,  Do one thing right, and continue to do it over and over and over.....  People do not stand in line for mediocre food or mediocre service, they stand in line to be a part of the culture to have the best Chicken, not just in the Carolina's, but as many will state and put in writing, the whole USA.  They are closed on Sundays and Mondays , so if you are new to the town, been here a while or just seem to know BO....., You need to see why the are rated one of the top chicken spots in the nation.    These folks are only open during Tuesday - Saturday 10am-6pm.  If you want to see what a real entrepreneur looks like, see how many people are working in this small, busy place on any given day.  Chicken Coop = "America's Chicken"  Oh yeah, CASH ONLY!  NCFoodGuy

Having been on the hunt for a crunchy tender fried chicken. This place takes the prize (sampling over 50+ different establishments). They proudly boast peanut oil is used in the fryer... which has a high flash point meaning the crispier fried chicken :), sealing in the natural juices.  Not like KFC (which uses a pressure cooker to push the oil into the meat).  Peanut oil tends to be more costly than other frying oils.  The only reason I found this place was driving down to Charleston and wanted to find a place where the locals go.  When a hole in the wall shack and saw a line of locals out the door and around the block in a run down neighborhood.  I knew it had to be special.  If you love hush puppies like my ex-fiancee, this is THE place to go as well.  Only if she stuck around long enough for me to take her. LOL

So juicy, so greasy, so good. When I read the book The Help, this is what I imagined what Mimi's fried chicken would taste like. I was raised in Kentucky, home of Colonel Sanders' KFC, Indi's, and numerous other fried chicken joints so I have pretty high standards when it comes to fried chicken. There's not a place to eat, which is why I am downgrading it a star since it's best when you eat it hot and fresh out of the fryer. It's definitely a whole in the wall and a madhouse in there with a ton of customers and a ton of employees. I split the whole dark chicken with a side of fries and a side of slaw. The meat was still juicy in spite of the perfectly crispy skin. The sides were okay. The star is definitely the chicken. Tip: this is a cash only place.

After reading all the raves and talking to a few locals, I put Price's on my hit list and felt I had a slam dunk for some down home Carolina mom and pop fried chicken.  So I got there on a rainy Wednesday at 11:30 AM to beat the lunch rush. Great, no lines, a no frills civil rights era looking store interior and 5 eager cashiers ready to take my order. I ordered the 4 piece or half chicken dinner, a side order of livers, and sweet tea. There was a short wait for the livers.   When I was called to get my prized white box of chicken, I felt like my number came up for a bingo jackpot. Could not wait to sink my teeth into what may be the best fried chicken I've ever eaten in my life.    Got into my car with rock star parking right in front of the store (no customer tables and chairs) and carefully arranged my food around the center stick, dash, and passenger seat. Finally the moment of truth - I picked up a leg and bit into it.... I then closed my eyes in disbelief. I almost cried.   IT WAS COLD. IT WAS NOT CRUNCHY. IT WAS PRE COOKED FRIED CHICKEN. AND TASTE WAS NOTHING THAT WOULD BLOW YOU AWAY.   Now, I recall all the chicken parts were sitting in separate piles waiting to be assebled into boxes to tame the crowd. The only thing I saw that was actually cooking, that hit the hot grease in the row of deep fryers, were my chicken livers.   But I will say the livers, tater rounds, hush puppies, and slaw was pretty good. They do a brisk business as many people were in and out with their white boxes of chicken. i JUST DON'T GET IT.

When writing a review about Price's, you have to talk about the fried chicken! so let me jump right in and say it's delicious. I was a bit skeptical about what the fuss was about, but I can definitely see why people like it so much.   It's always packed in here. They only accept cash. There don't allow substitutions. And they charge for hot sauce.  But you know what? all of that stuff is fine. The chicken is awesome and the price is very very reasonable. I recall the hash browns also being really good too. The hush puppies, slaw and roll weren't bad.  The chicken was excellent. Definitely a must try when you're in Charlotte! Do it! boom.
Nothing special as I thought it would be. Very different being I'm from Houston I've never eaten tatot tots and hush puppies with fried chicken. Tea was inspiring though.

My Prices Chicken experience was pretty rad. The chicken was well seasoned, moist, and fried to perfection. The slaw was a little heavy on the vinegar but tasted great after a little pepper was added. My only negative was the soggy greasy tater rounds. The amount of grease and texture (almost mushy) was a little much for me. However, mine was picked up and driven a good ten minutes before I ate it so that could have played a huge part in the finished product.  Over all it was a great filling meal for 6 bucks you really can't beat it.
A Charlotte landmark! Best fried chicken in town. Bring Cash and know what you want before you order because they are usually slammed.

With the reviews found suggesting this was must when visiting Charlotte, I had to check it out.   Therefore while there in early December, that's exactly what I did. Staying in the Epicenter, I took the rail which put me about 2 blocks away from Prices within 10 minutes.   Thankfully the line wasn't out the door (2pm on weekday), but it was busy inside. I'm glad that I didn't plan on dining in as there were no tables, chairs, counters, etc. I saw several people eating in their cars, across the street on the lawn by the rails, and down the block seated on top of anything they could find.   Despite being pretty busy, the line moved fast and the food came out quickly. When I asked for hot sauce, I was told it would be a nickel. Obviously, that's not much but seeing how chicken and hot-sauce go so well together why not just give a pack (like they do with the ketchup)?   While I thought the chicken was good, it wasn't AMAZING. So, why am I giving it 4 stars? Because I did enjoy it would definitely get it again...and again.  If I'm back in the area I'll have to try the sweet tea.

It puts me to sleep! I genuinely love this place, and it will put you to sleep. I got the 4 piece wing chicken  dinner.  It comes with a roll, hushpuppies, chicken,  tater tots and a small coleslaw. You have to have cash, no credit cards. The only thing is, sometimes because the food is cooked and ready to go it isn't as hot.  But it's still delicious. Love it

"Come hungry and leave overstuffed." That should be under the sign at Price's Chicken Coop. I have been dying to try this place since i moved here in October. My apartment is right around the corner and every money when i go to my car all i can smell is fried chicken. Finally this weekend i grabbed some cash and went with my parents. We decided to get a whole bird because there were 3 of us and it seemed more economical than individual dinners. We also got sides of coleslaw, tater totes, and hush puppies. Oh damn those hush puppies. They were the sole reason i left stuffed. They were way too good and everything about them was memorizing. I will be the first to admit i am not much of a chicken person. I loved deep fried food like the rest of America but i'll take beef over chicken any day. Price's chicken is very good. It is tender and very well spiced. My only complaint is that i wish the skin had been crispier. Mine was somewhat soggy and that is disappointing since the skin is always my favorite part. The tater totes are good but nothing to write home about and my dad loved the coleslaw. All in all my advice is that no matter what you order at Price's make sure you get plenty of hush puppies.

Pretty good chicken. I expected my mind to be blown so in that sense i'm a little disappointed but it's still solid. I got there at 12:05 to no line, but right after, it blew up.  I wouldn't say it's worth standing in line for super long for.

What a bummer!   So I moved to Charlottes Historic Southend last week and knew right away that I had to try the ever-raved about Price's Chicken Coop.   I had high expectations- since Ive heard nothing but great things about this place.    I went this Saturday for lunch and ran into a crowd (expected) but I heard the line went fast- and just figured it was a good sign! After about 15 minutes of fully-expected wait time I made my selection the 1/4 lb white chicken meal complete with a roll, hushpuppies, and coleslaw for only $6!  I walked down to the Common Market to grab a drink and sit outside to eat my meal- (CM rocks by the way!) ...  When I actually ate my chicken I was more than disappointed. While I am never one to completely disregard an eating establishment because its a so-called hole in the wall (as this is) I do expect it to be sanitary. I immediately encountered a large black curly hair (that was definitely not mine) ... I was so disgusted- I put that piece in the garbage and tried to regain some of my appetite  and at least give the other piece a try. The chicken was fairly dry and definitely nothing special. There wasn't a lot of meat at all - and Ive had better chicken at KFC  which isn't saying much. ...The Coleslaw had no carrots or anything and was ok in flavor- basically a sweet watery-mayonnaise shredded cabbage mixture...nothing great. The highlight of the meal were the hushpuppies- which were perfect in every way.  I do feel like I will give this one more chance since everyone else claims it's so great...maybe I just had one outlying bad experience.

I have been wanting to try this place since moving to Charlotte but its so hard for me to get there when they close at 6 during the week! Finally stopped in on a Saturday. It's like a step back in time and I love it. The lady working the counter was so sweet and helpful. I ordered a half chicken plate for my boyfriend and I to share. The chicken was good, but I would not say best I have ever had. After a 7 minute drive home the fries were not fresh. Good amount of food for the money!

I have to say that Eric is about as spot-on as it gets.  I don't really like fried chicken with bones either.  I'm a breast (no bones) man myself.  But I love me some Price's chicken.  That's how good it is.  There's nothing quite like forcing yourself into that mass of humanity and coming out with a greasy box of chicken (and fixin's) and running through the meadow to your family in Freedom Park and digging in.  Unfortunately there seems to be less chicken in the box when you arrive at the park than when you left.  I don't understand how that works.  Nonetheless - it's greasy.  That's what makes it good.  Deal with it.  The Coop doesn't close at any particular time, no matter what anyone says.  They close when the chicken runs out, so if you want chicken, you get there early.
