In other words, don't get your underwear in a bunch to get there just before the doors close, because there is a very good chance that it's all going to be gone.  These people have been doing their job for a long time - they aren't going to run out right at closing time.  That's when they go home.  That means everything is shut down and cleaned up then.  The chicken will have been long gone by then.  On the process - it's like the Soup Nazi, without the need to stand in line and move two steps to the left.  It's more like a somewhat-controlled mob.  Have your cash ready and when you get to the counter, place your order.  If you get to the counter and don't have your order, be prepared for someone else to take your place.  And don't go getting upset, okay?  You've now been warned.

Greasy, heavy and artery-clogging. Every time I have their dark meat chicken dinner, it makes me wonder why I let myself do that again.  And it's so worth it. The way fried chicken meals are supposed to be, if you ask me. Mmm, tasty.  There's a huge line there all the time for a reason.   But they do have it down to a science. The line goes fast.

Saw a posted news paper clipping that was a bucketlist for Charlotte. For food, it said you have to try Price's Chicken Coop. This place lived up to the hype. Had tastes of the fried dark chicken, the hushpuppies, the cole slaw, the sweet tea and the sweet potato pie.  All of these (particularly the chicken, the hushpuppies and the sweet potato pie) were some of the best of that dish I have had in my life. Also went with a friend and we were able to get a lot of food for $7 combined.

Two words: Hangover Cure. (Okay maybe that's four).  I'm from a small little nugget town called Trinity in NC so I welcomed the small cookout-fundraiser feel of this place. "Get you some fried chicken. Get you some fried fish!" It highlights Southern staples in the heart of the city!   A little nauseous from the night before, I NEEDED some grease. So I got me a "plate" and it was bombbb! (Reference my pic) Oh and I'm a hugeee pepsi fan, and any soda lover knows that drinking out of a CAN is key and they had vending machines!! Whew!  Needless to say, what everyone says about this place being Heaven's restaurant choice in Charlotte is true, my hangover was healed! Hallelujah!  You're welcome.

If I can give more than 5 stars, I'd give price 10 and then some! I ordered the dark chicken sandwich w potato salad for $3.50 and sweet tea on the side. Affordability wassup!  Side note: I asked the cashier if there were bones in the chicken sandwich and she looked at me like I was crazy and answered with one word, "yeah". Chicken was juicy, just the right amount of crisp too. Potato salad... I'm sure it was good, but it's all about the chicken and the sweet tea (not to sweet but sweet enough)! Def going back here. Make sure to have cash although they do have an atm machine inside.   And be prepared to wait in line for awhile even though lines seem short because some staff take their sweet time servicing you. But it's worth it!

Awesome chicken and sweet tea. I also love the fried gizzards. The few inconveniences of the place is that they only take cash, there's no seating available, the limited hours, and the lack of parking due to the area.

Good fried chicken - no big shock there. This place has been a Charlotte staple for eons.   However...I have to say I actually LOVE their fried shrimp dinner! The tartar sauce is delish. It's not super heavy breading, either. And I could probably eat 1,000 of their hush puppies without blinking.   I'm not the biggest fan of their coleslaw - but I'm not a huge coleslaw fan anyway, so don't hold that against them. If you're a healthy schmealthy eater, there's no need to go to Price's, there's nothing remotely healthy on this menu! :)
as far as fried chicken goes, this place is great!!!! Beware of the hours and they only take cash. Deffinetly worth a visit.

Best Chicken Anywhere, The Coop is own by the Price's and has been a family owned business for several generations. My family has been going to Price's for many decades, Through my travels I have learned all Chicken isn't created equal, and Price's is at the top of the coop...  The Chicken is cooked to a Crispy perfection, you will seldom fine elsewhere, and the price is the best deal around.  The Tea is real brewed southern tea, sweetened brewed to perfection... Things to take note of:  This is not a sit down to eat place, however on any given day you will find people sitting outside, because that is as far as they could get before giving in to the delights of those first bites.  They are not open on Sundays or Mondays  And they close everyday at 6pm They do not take Cards or Checks  "CASH ONLY"

Hubby and I came in October and shared a 2-piece chicken dinner which came with a soft dinner roll, a generous portion of crunchy tater tots, a small container of slaw and potato salad, all served in a well-organized packed pie box .  The chicken had a crispy light breading and the meat was very juicy and flavorful.  Only cash and take-out here.  They have a very efficient assembly line to get hungry customers served and on their merry way!  Fortunately, there was a nice grassy knoll across the street with plenty of shade ... this served as the perfect spot for us to savor our yummy lunch!
This is truly the best Fried Chicken I've had in the 29 years I've lived in Charlotte.  It's affordable and quick service, even when the lines are out the door.

Hello #400 Yelp Review! I've been saving Price's for this momentous occasion. Price's has been a Charlotte institution since as far back as I remember. It wasn't long after my family moved here in 1996 for us to discover the city's best Mom and Pop fried chicken joint. I've actually never been inside the store since someone else usually orders and picks up the chicken for me but I can imagine that the line can get long at peak dining hours. The food is well worth the wait.  First off, the entire menu fits on the top of the take out box. You know they mean business since they offer just a few things but execute each and every one of those menu items well. The dinners are a complete meal with the main entree accompanied by crinkle fries, two hushpuppies, coleslaw, and a roll. Everything is made with 100% peanut oil and 100% love. The fries are crispy on the outside and chewy in the inside like those fries I used to get from the elementary school cafeteria. The hushpuppies are balls of fried perfection. The slaw has the perfect balance of vinegar and mayo, not too runny either. The fried chicken is out of this world. Well seasoned and crispy skin encasing succulent, juicy, and tender meat. It's been awhile since I've had it so when we ordered it the other week I was temporarily transported back to fried chicken heaven. My parents love their gizzards.  We used to only get Price's on specially occasions and settle for Bojangles the rest of the time, but now my brother lives within walking distance from it. In fact you can see Price's from the entrance of his condo building. So dangerous but so convenient so we can scope out the line before heading over.

Wow not what I was hoping for. My first ever experience was very short of the expected hype around this place. Very friendly staff food came to me quick but the negative parts come now. I sit in my car bite into my breast and nothing but oil and grisle come out. Very little meat very greasy. The wing was far better then the breast I'm sure the legs would be decent but for sure not the best fried chicken I've had. Not even the best fried chicken in charlotte. I wanted to love this place but can't say I'll be back.

Some of the best fried chicken in the south, certainly the best in Charlotte.  We have this catered at work a few times a year.  The restaurant itself has lots of character and is in an interesting neighborhood (on the train tracks by fat burrito and common market), so it makes for a good stop and some interesting photos.  You can smell the fried goodness as you drive up from blocks away.

It was recommended as some of the best fried chicken in the nation by Bon Appetit Magazine, Diane Sawyer, Jay Leno, and the bus driver on my tour of Charlotte, so as a bona fide foodie, I knew that I would have to give their chicken a try! And yep, I think that they were right! The marinated chicken is seasoned just right, breaded with crispy deliciousness, and deep fat fried in a marvelous taste producing peanut oil. The results were simply yum! A half chicken dinner is reasonably priced at just over $10 and comes with potato rounds, Cole slaw, and just about perfect hush puppies. Now, all of that deep fried goodness may not be really good for you, but you could just consider a salad for dinner while you enjoy chicken bliss for lunch!  Two warnings before you rush over...they accept cold hard cash only...keep your cards in your wallet. Second, the food comes in a box to go. You will have to be patient a little while longer to enjoy the food in another location. Please consider the safety of all around you and do not scarf down the chicken and drive. Enjoy the bird responsibly!

Went here as a recommendation from a tour of Charlotte. It really is the best fried chicken in town. The chicken was very tasty and the outside was nice and crispy. I also recommend getting the sweet tea it's very tasty.
Friendly people, quick service, and dank chicken. This is a must if you live in Clt or are here visiting. The line goes real quick so no worries about a long wait.

It's not the best i had, maybe i don't like crunchy style as much.   The potato salad is excellent.  Price is decent.  Service....  is there!  Line moves fast and quality is very consistent.  Overall a great take out lunch spot.

The chicken gets 5+ stars but their sides are not that great (fine, just generic). Then again, if you're visiting Price's for the slaw, you're doing it wrong. I'm certainly not an authority on the matter, but it is the best fried chicken I've ever had.   I recently had some family in town who grabbed lunch there on my suggestion. They liked it so much they went back a couple days later (even though we had a lot of other recommendations for them)!   Don't be intimidated by the long lines as the cashiers keep everything moving smoothly despite the small space.

Had this chicken on more than one occasion.  It has to be the worst crap I have ever had.It has no spice to it whatsoever.  It tastes like someone just threw flour on it and nothing else.  The only thing I did like from there is the potato salad....don't know if they still have the potato salad because I haven't been in years.. Bottom line I have had better chicken from Bojangles. This crap must have some kind of mind control drug in it to convince all these people in Charlotte that this chicken is special.

The fried chicken was breaded perfectly and fresh. I don't usually like Curley fries but I had no problem with Price's. You get so much food for the price and it is well worth it. You might need a nap afterwards

Wow! The food is incredible. Well worth the 3 1/2 hour car ride from Myrtle Beach. The staff was not the friendliest, but the service was speedy. If you are ever in the area, you need to check out this place....it's that good!!!

Fried Chicken was hot and on point! The shrimp were not impressive and pretty bad to me. Play it safe and enjoy the fish or chicken if you want to indulge in fried food! The iced sweet tea was near perfection!

This place has a lot of character, which I love. It's nice to know that a business run by mostly black people FOR black people can survive in an area that is quickly being populated by young white couples and their babies. #GentrificationIsReal  The lady who took my order was a very sweet and friendly woman. Definitely gave off that "Southern hospitality" vibe that I had felt was lacking in my travels around Charlotte.  I ordered the 2 piece Dark Meat Chicken dinner. The chicken was solid. It was crispy but not greasy and clearly fresh. The meat itself was seasoned - I bet they brine it beforehand. I could eat a whole bucket of this chicken.  The sides felt like a hit or miss. The standard dinner roll was basic - I could do without it. I think it would be better if it was hot. The hushpuppies were awesome. They had a sweet onion flavor to them. The fries were alright - but also pretty basic. I would probably swap the fries for tator rounds or fried giblets.  The food came out very quickly and I didn't have to wait, but that was because I came in at 10am. And it was already pretty busy, so keep that in mind.  Cash and takeout only. There's a wooden table a block away if you want to eat it right there.

Let me start off by saying that I am from the North and do not know fried chicken like the people in the south.  Prices Chicken Coop is a staple in Charlotte.  I have been here 3 different times and every time was quick and tasty.  It is only take out and they only accept Cash, they do have an ATM on site.    The chicken is the best I have had and the sides are also great.  When I am in the mood for Fried Chicken Prices always hits the spot.    I also believe they close at 6 everyday.  Definitely worth a stop if you find yourself in southend.

Drop your bags and head to price's. Seriously, since it really is that good. I didn't want to jump on the bandwagon and give this place a 4. But I honestly didn't have a problem with any part of the food (if we're talking about the lack of seating, well that's another story).   Like what others said, enter the store and jump into one of the lines once you know what you want. The folks there knows how to work fast to get you in and out ready to enjoy your chicken. My boyfriend and I shared a whole dark chicken (4 thighs and 2 legs) and a side of hush puppies. First off, the prices here are insane. I didn't know that you were still able to get a whole chicken for 10 bucks anywhere in town.  Ok, finally the food. The whole car ride home my boyfriend and I were dying to grab a taste of its crispy chicken because the smell was so strong. However, it was worth the wait. The skin was so crispy and you can taste that they use fresh oil for frying the chicken. The meat was tender and fell off the bone. The hush puppies were great as well, better than most places for sure.  Would I come back again? Most definitely. It's already on my to do list when I come back to Charlotte

this is a good spot to pick up some food.  STAY AWAY FROM THE BURGERS... the name of the place is PRICE'S "CHICKEN" COOP... not Burger King.  Chicken sandwich = 3wings (bone in) and a bun Perch dinner is good (u get 5-7 pieces)  But to be honest... its just a chicken spot.. you have to work pretty hard to mess up Fried chicken (especially being a business).  i believe its overhyped. (not meaning its not good). Kinda makes me think of those long lines out the door of Starbucks. (it can't be that good..... can it?)  all in all....... if you're looking for some good chicken.. and TEA (kinda too sweet for my liking) if you don't mind passing other places just to get here...  Comeeeee onnnn downnnnnnn!!!!!!

Because the South does have an excuse for high obesity rates with fried chicken like this.  Price's fried chicken is SO good that I bite off the bones accidentally, and say aw f* it, i'll suck on it for the flavor.  I just keep repeating to myself, "dont swallow the bones deanna, don't do it, it's not smart. resist deanna resist."  $4.21 for 2 pieces of fried chicken, slaw, and sweet tea with no ice. So cheap!!! I don't know why anyone would give this place less than 4 stars. I just don't.  After having tried fried chicken all over in Charlotte and supposedly good fried chicken in nyc by a chef that hails he's from the south -- holy crap people mess up fried chicken big time.  You know how sometimes it seems like asian girls are remarkably skinny and tiny?  Well price's fried chicken can change the skinny part for any asian girl.  You want to fatten up your asian girl? Price's fried chicken is the place to go. Tip 1 - get the dark meat.  Tip 2 - to prevent food coma, chicken sandwich (basically two pieces of fried chicken with bones in between 2 pieces of neglected buns. Tip 3 - get the dinner box for dinner with extra hush puppies

This place has the best fried chicken I have found in Charlotte! The skin is crispy and great flavors. The chicken is juicy and comes with tater tots, slaw and a roll. 1/4 white chicken meal was a lot of food. The line was long but the checkout was quick. One tip of new, this place doesn't have seating so expect to eat in your car or take it home. Don't let that stop you though as it's awesome. They also only take cash.

Went here with some of my family when they were visiting. I've lived in South End for nearly three months and walked past this place/heard about it many times. I had the 4 wing dinner which is a lot of food for the price. It was all fresh and delicious! Chicken had the perfect amount of crunchy exterior and juicy meat. Only reasons I didn't give five stars are that their hush puppies are nothing spectacular, but you only get two of them and the .85 tea is mostly ice.   I will definitely return in the near future!

actually better than the first time and that goes some.  i enjoy the food production in preparing & cooking your food. love me some white meat and they do it right! It is not dry and is tender .... that is an accomplishment!  In my travels, I always look for barbecue FIRST, then a good local place for fried chicken. Every community has someone who canary the hell outta of some chicken1 Every community - remember that. Well ...... Price's Chicken Coop is that place in Charlotte.  If you are visiting you have to try it!  If you are driving through Charlotte, it is absolutely with the slight detour.  You can continue your trip humming to yourself contented & satisfied. You will thank me.  They have it figured out. They charge 85 cents for sweet tea BUT $1.50 if you don'y want ice in it. That is funny because we all order "light ice" or "no ice" so that we can get more drink.   They know that trick and make you pay for it!   That is too funny!!!

Today was our first visit to Price's and we will definitely be back. The fried chicken was some of the best I've ever had. It was golden brown, tender and juicy. The sides, especially the hush puppies, were amazing and the sweet tea was delicious. It was a busy Saturday, but we didn't wait long in line and we're enjoying our chicken platters within minutes. Give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

01/10/13  My wife and I were traveling south from VA to SC for a 4 day vacation.  I had heard about Price's by watching Adam on Man V Food.  I had been looking forward to it ever since we left Iowa in Nov.  We arrived just before noon.  It was some what busy.  There were approximately 20+ staff 15 or so were working and the others were just standing around.  For get about Burger King's getting your way.  Here at Price's you get it their way no exceptions.  After waiting about 25 minutes we got our food and got out of there to find a place to eat in our truck.  The chicken was mostly old and cold.  The chicken livers were over cooked to the point of being dehydrated.  The only thing that was good hot and fresh was an order of fried OKRA.  The help was very abrupt and very unfriendly.  I tried to speak to one that was not working and was completely ignored.  Oh' well,  the good thing about it is that we will never have to go back.  Maybe it was just a bad day to go there.

Whenever I go out of town on a business trip, I always do my best to try new places.  I use a combination of Yelp, Road Food sites, and friends or coworkers to point me in the right direction.  When I inquired about the Charlotte area, everyone recommend Price's Chicken Coop!    I showed up around 12 noon on a Saturday and was expecting long lines.  It was busy but not as crazy as I expected.  I only waited about a min or so before the nice cashier called me over to her to take my order.  I told her this was my first time here and had heard great things about their food.  She gave me a great big smile and welcomed me.  I ordered the half chicken dark meat dinner.  I also got a sweet potato fried pie.  She disappeared and came back with a white box and bag. I paid my bill (bring cash... They don't do cards!) and walked out with my food.  There was a steady stream of people coming and going  Now there is no place to sit here... It is strictly counter service.  I saw people siting outside on the ground... On stairs... In their cars... Where ever they could to enjoy their chicken hot. I went back to my car and opened up the box.... And it looked and smelled so good!  I was going to take it back to my hotel room to eat but decided it was too far away and the chicken would be cold so I had a picnic in my car!  The chicken was the best I have ever had.  I love me some Publix Chicken but this beats it hands down.  The dinner had two legs, two thighs, french fries, cold slaw, and two hush puppies.  It was filling for me but it was too good to not eat while hot.  I saved the pie for later in the day and that too was great but I should have heated it up in the microwave first.  I would have been better warm.  Atmosphere = 5  Service = 8  Food = 10  I really enjoyed the experience of Prices and will try to go back one more time before I leave. Just bring cash and your hunger and you won't be disappointed!  Enjoy!

EXCELLENT!!!!  Some of the best fried chicken I've ever tasted.  This place can be crowded, but it is so worth the trip and the wait.  It has been there for years and famous in Charlotte.   You can't eat there, you have to take it to go.  They give you a lot of fried potatoes and hush puppies with the meals, which makes you feel even more full.  But I would definitely go back to just get a half chicken and nothing else.  LOVED IT!!!!!!!!

Just about the best Southern fried chicken you will ever eat. They also have fried fish, shrimp, chicken livers, and gizzard plates. They have sandwiches but I wouldn't waste my time on those.  This is a takeout only, and parking is on the street or in one of the lots close by. I usually just eat my prize on the hood of my car. For fried chicken lovers, this is as good as it gets.  Oh yeah, best to come early.

SMALLEST CHICKEN LEGS IVE EVER SEEN! Just ok. Not impressed. Maybe it was hyped up way too much, but I didn't find anything fantastic about this chicken. We ordered the 1/4 chicken dark and it included 2 pieces dark chicken, tiny cole slaw, roll, couple hush puppies, and fries. You definitely get your money's worth. The pieces are way too small. The chicken is crunchy and has a nice taste, but it's not anywhere close to fried chicken I've gotten elsewhere. I've eaten better chicken at the gas station on Providence Road in Ballantyne and delicious chicken at the Cajun Yard Dog at the Arboretum! The fries are good, tho. They stayed nice and crunchy on the way home. Cole slaw pretty good. Potato salad would've been better had they not put so much seasoning in it, house seasoning, I presume. Service quick and friendly, tho. Seriously, my fried chicken is better than this place.. Yo, I should've known when I saw that white people ran it. Damn, I wanted this place to be as great as they say. But sadly, it ain't no thang but a chicken wang.

You know when someone tells you that "You have to try" this or that... or "This is the best place."  Typically, either your expectations are too high and you are let down, or the place really isn't that good in the first place.  Well, Price's Chicken lives up to the hype.  This is THE best chicken I have ever had.  I do not say that lightly.  It is counter service, and even the long line move fast... I would recommend going at an off-time so you can be in and out because the lines get long.  Definitely try this place.
The best chicken in town. If it's good enough for Jay Leno and many of the Carolina Panthers then you will surely love it.

I didn't like it at all. We got chicken, fish and shrimp. They all tastes the same (like batter and old frying oil). The hush puppies were so disappointing. I would never go back or recommend it to anyone. We shared a lot of food for 6 of us, paid $50ish and everyone who had the meal with us didn't like it at all. My friend said that the best thing about the meal was the coke. He's right.

This was my first visit and let me tell you, i was very excited. I had heard so many good things about this place and could not wait to try it for myself.   I ordered the 1/4 dark with fries,  cole slaw, hush puppies, and a roll. My wife had the bbq plate with fries, hush puppies, roll, and slaw. While i liked my plate she did not enjoy her's very much. She said her bbq was dry and had a bad after taste.   Although i liked my plate, i thought it was just "ok". I don't know what i was expecting. Maybe i hyped it up too much in my head. Either way, i didn't dislike the place but i wasn't impressed either. I think everyone should at least try it. After all, this place is a Charlotte landmark.  I want to add, staff was very friendly and fast.

Stopped by Price's Coop hoping for a WOW moment . It didn't happen. Their chicken is cooked perfectly but something was obviously missing. There is no flavor.. Reading these reviews hyped me up so much. I'm not sure where the rest of you reviewers ate your chicken from but, this is definitely not at the top of the list.

This is some goooooooood chicken. Haberdish should take note because THIS is how you make fried chicken. In the short time it takes to order and get your food it is still enough time to notice how friendly everyone is.   Obviously the chicken is top notch so on my last trip I tried the fish sandwich for the first time and boy was it yummy. LOADS of fish that was perfectly seasoned and slathered with tartar sauce. Also don't sleep on the potato salad. I always get a side of it when I get a chicken dinner. Am I disappointed that they no longer have tater rounds? Sure. But if they are going to have fries at least they have crinkle fries.   A take out place with fried items that has perfected packaging to keep your food crispy and hot until you get home BONUS!....that is if you haven't torn into the box on the drive home. Be warned however, after eating here DO NOT OPERATE HEAVY MACHINERY ...or try to be productive at work, because all you will want to do is curl up and nap. But you will have a happy belly.
Wow! Best chicken anywhere and done by really great people.  Just hate it that I don't live closer by....but it is worth the drive!

Wow! The hype is real. Best friend chicken I've ever had. A perfect browned crispy crust that's full of flavor while the inside is juicy but not greasy. Fries, hush puppies, and roll was amazing too. Super fast service, in and out in less than 2 minutes. Cash only is the only down side.

Price's Chicken Coop in Charlotte is an unassuming little spot. Barely noticeable from the street, the interior is rather simple and plain. There are no tables inside, and only a couple of chairs for waiting customers. The place is take-out only. There is no seating outside, but some people take their food and eat it across the street in a grassy little area, or to take home or back to work.  During my visit, there was a never ending stream of customers coming in and out.  The menu is simple and straight forward. Fried chicken, fried fish and several side options.  They also offer hamburgers, but I did not see anybody order those.  The chicken is super crisp and crunchy on the outside, and very moist and juicy on the inside. Juices were running down my hand with every piece.  The hush puppies were somewhat dry however. They were also lacking any deep corn flavor.  Price's is definitely worth a visit for their fried chicken. In fact, Jay Leno stopped by the place earlier in the year.

I was excited to try this place out and i was very let down by what we got.  The chicken itself was good, the sides were not.  Chicken was crispy and quite nice but the Mac and cheese, hush puppies and greens seemed to be made from a box.
This chicken is perfect. The staff is really nice! No place to eat here, we ended up getting green juices a few doors down and enjoyed the irony of consuming those things together.

Did NOT live up to the hype. At all.  I want to just chalk it up to an off day, or a fluke bad experience, but they forgot my order completely, my husband found the three wing sandwich left a lot to be desired, though my son seemed to really enjoy his hamburger. And tater tots were heavily fried with a lot of residual oil and a little over crispy, and the hush puppies had very little flavor other than oil and bread.  Because it's not an eat in establishment, plan to eat nearby, either in your car, or in a nearby park. I think the chicken may have been improved upon had we eaten it a little sooner. We drove around for about 10 minutes trying to find a shady spot to eat. But I have to say, I've had great fried chicken, good fried chicken, and okay fried chicken. Frankly my last trip to Popeyes was more satisfying all around.

I finally got around to trying Price's Chicken Coop.  I made it there on a Thursday about 5:45 which 15 minutes before they close.  The cliffs note version: Cash only (there is an atm), carry out only.  I got the 1/2 chicken all white which was under $10 including tax.  It came with tater rounds, hush puppies, coleslaw and a roll.  This was all contained in a nice white square cardboard box with the menu/checklist of contents printed on the top.  It took me about 20 minutes to get home and the chicken was still pretty warm.  The crust was still crispy and the chicken was still moist.  With fried chicken your gonna have grease, but to me it seemed to be just about the right amount.  Is this the best chicken I've ever eaten?  No, but it rates up towards the top of my list. It reminded me of the pan fried chicken my grandmother used to make, which to me is the best chicken in the world.  Yes the tater rounds are frozen, but they were crispy and delicious to me.  And I have never, ever heard of tater rounds ever being anything but frozen.   The hush puppies were excellent.  The roll was standard packaged dinner roll. The slaw was diced, with not too much dressing and little bit of a bite.  Overall Price's Chicken Coop serves old school fried chicken that is some of the best I have had and to me the prices was very reasonable.  I haven't been in Charlotte too long, but I imagine if I had been here 15 or 30 years ago it would still be the same except for the prices and that is saying something.

HOW HAVE I LIVED IN CHARLOTTE FOR NEARLY A YEAR AND NEVER EATEN HERE????  Delicious, juicy, amazing chicken.  Can't wait to go back and eat all the chicken!  Down side is parking is atrocious and they only serve tea.  They have drink machines but you have to put exact change in.  Lame.

The food is great and I can't deny it but I had to take away a star for the meet and greet aspect. I'm not one of those who you need to know my name when I walk in but I like knowing that no matter how well you do as a business you care that I came. Nothing was said and nothing was done but it's just the vibe that I get each time I go which makes me not go maybe as often as I could.

Love their fried chicken, and their white box is famous.  We usually order and take to park, and people will spot the box and come over.  No plastic accepted, so make sure you have cash.  One of my main stops.

Ordered 1/4 white box for lunch.  Also ordered gizzards to share with my party (not the most popular party gift).    Five stars for chicken- delicious and moist. Possibly the best fried chicken I have ever had.  Five stars for tots- great texture and taste.  Five stars for the price. One of many good and economical lunches in Charlotte. In Phoenix (home) it seems like chain fast food is the only way to eat lunch under $10.  Four stars for the slaw  Three stars for hush puppies. Dry and not much taste.  Three stars for gizzards- too light on the breading for my taste.  I will be back but stay clear of gizzards.

I'm not sure what else to say about this place that hasn't been already said. This place is LEGIT. Lines are long but goes fast. Chicken has always been fresh as can be when I go there.  Chicken is the best I have tried in the south so far.  The service was top notch also. The south for sure is very very nice and friendly and this place is no exception.  This is my place to eat again when coming back to NC.

Wish I had never eaten here because now I am addicted. I have avoided for years and finally broken down and tried... now I have been back almost weekly since. The chicken is the BEST, I have never had friend chicken so good.. its still just as good cold or the next day (for breakfast of course). I have been mentioning to people I went and they say its so good, they hadnt been in while and end up going and getting re-addicted to it. The place is busy, packed.. and bring cash.. service quick thou - 2 registers and 4 cashiers, its great. Its a must visit if you are from out of town or have guests here. I think I will eat there Friday!

YAAAS! YAAAAAAAAAS! Price's is seriously the best fried chicken I have ever had. Of the 2 times I've been here, they have had huge piles of chicken, hot right out of the fryer. The batter is super light and crisp with a satisfying crunch that won't break your teeth or rip your gums like some other places. The 2-piece dark dinner hits the spot just right. But to be honest, the first time I had it, I walked right back in and ordered a second 2-piece dark for the road. The dinners come with fries, coleslaw, 2 hushpuppies, and a dinner roll (Kings Hawaiian maybe?). Anyways, the fried chicken and hushpuppies are amazing. I would stay clear of the fried chicken gizzards though unless you like super soft and flaccid ones...lol. It seems like they tenderize them and aren't kept as hot as everything else. I'm used to gizzards with a crunchy/rubbery texture so the limp/tender gizzards just don't do it for me. Def isn't fresh out of the fryer though so be warned if you actually enjoy it flaccid.

Ok, first, the staff is so sweet. I ran in just before closing and they opened the door at least a dozen people behind me. The ladies behind the counter were super sweet. Since this is my first time I have just been dying to try the chicken. It was super good.  They were out of french fries so i tried the huspuppies, man are they big.  The potato salad and slaw were both really good and very fresh. I just wish they were open later as if you want to pick up after work and work until 5:30, you have to run. I wish they had a hot side like collard greens or mac and cheese, but I will be back for sure. Glad to see a home opened business still in business since 1962. Hope they stay around for many more years. I look forward to stopping in again
Ratchet crunk.  You want a coronary then go here.  They spare no grease or lard.

Organized chaos is what the kitchen looks like as you squeeze into this local spot. But oh my! The goodness that comes out of that open kitchen is amazing. Be prepared, there is always a line but it moves quickly. The menu is pretty basic, different combos of chicken (1/4 dark, 1/4 light, wings) with standard sides of slaw, fries and hush puppies. It's seasoned so perfectly that I often wait for my late grandmother to emerge from the kitchen and say "Hi"! I have had the fish sandwich, too, which is very tasty. But the chicken is a must!  Take a drink with you if you don't like really sweet sweet tea. And be prepared to eat either in your vehicle or on a curb nearby as there's no seating inside. You'll see people strolling the streets eating from their boxes because they can't wait to sit down to indulge.   If you come to Charlotte, make sure you check out this awesome local favorite.

Oh man oh man oh man! I'm glad I live in WA state or else I would be going to Price's at least three times a week! I stopped on my way to the airport and got the two white meat chicken lunch. I got one wing and one breast with a bun (like a hamburger bun). The chicken was to die for! And I had ate it cold during my layover in Chicago! I also ordered a pecan pie (what's visiting the south without having one?), but it was a pre packaged Sara Lee pie... wish they made their own. The chicken was nice and moist and the best part is that even though it was cold it still had a crunch to the battered portion.   There were so many people that the line was out the door. The store front is very small so there were three separate (or four not sure) lines so they could keep us moving along to get our chicken fix. I can't wait to visit my best friend again so I can get more chicken!
Best fried chicken in town, a great walk in get your food and then enjoy.  Super fast service with very friendly staff that always welcomes you with a smile.

Price's is a true staple in Charlotte and should be visited by all. I have been several times over my 20 years in Charlotte and it does not disappoint. If you like Fried Chicken this is your spot.  Price's is take out only and that doesn't seem to be hurting business, although I do wish they had a little dining area. The food is cooked to order and meals typically come with hush puppies, slaw and a roll. They do offer other items, like perch, shrimp and more, which are all great too.  If you haven't been check them out. And, it is a great place to pick up some food and head to a park or even your backyard to enjoy!
Come here every time from Cali SF. Good authentic southern flavor that I can't get back home. LOVE IT

The chicken is the best.  The sides?  Well who cares about them!  It's still cheap too, a whole bird perfectly fried and moist doesn't break then bank either.    It's cash only.  There is no where to sit.  Ordering is hard with the large crowd.  And it's been that way for decades for a reason - the fryers are the same, and the peanut oil is probably too!  But it's so darn tasty.    Warning - that Grease and oil don't leave you feeling great, but it's worth it once in a while!
My favorite chicken joint. Fresh, hot and tasty. One of a kind. Cash only and it closes at 6pm

This place was really good! Loved the service and the fried chicken. They were crazy busy but taking care of people so quickly. The fried chicken was awesome - not too greasy. We would definitely return next time we are in Charlotte!

Popped in to give this place a try as I've heard nothing but good things about their chicken. And the raves are correct. This is really good chicken. A meaty chicken breast that was moist with a very crispy batter that wasn't so thick that it overwhelmed the chicken.  I got a two piece dinner, which came with a dinner roll, a small tub of cole slaw, some tater tots, some hushpuppies and the previously mentioned chicken - one wing and one breast. The tots were excellent. Not too greasy at all, but I was glad to have the one packet of ketchup for dipping.  This was a serious "fried" plate. If they could fry the cold slaw and the dinner roll, I'll bet they would have done so.  Note: This place is TAKE OUT ONLY. There is no dining area that I could see.
Hype isn't hype if it's true. This is hands down the best fried chicken I've ever had. Can't wait to go back.

It has been a while since I have visited the Coop.  Primarily because of their hours and open days since I don't live in the area.  On my way Uptown, I made a stop with the kids.  Since they don't accept cards, I had just enough cash to order two meals for three people...no drinks.  We always order the chicken which is always satisfying.  The tray is served with the round hash browns but we usually substitute one for the potato salad.  Their potato salad is SO GOOD!  However, the price and amount that you get are not equal.  The serving size is smaller now, probably 3-4 tablespoons at most.  This is only enough to feed a one-year old!  I was disappointed.  I don't plan to visit the Coop anytime soon.  It is no longer worth the trip, nor the $.  In addition, there were loiterers outside panhandling (against the rules) which is not good for business.

My review is based on the business integrity... Food Truck Friday is a great family oriented event that happens across the way from this establishment; Chicken Coop closes by 6 p.m. Families were using their parking lot to attend FTF AFTER Chicken Coop was closed... this business had vehicles parked there booted &/or towed... over 30 vehicles. After witnessing families with children standing with young kids trying to hunt down their vehicles... I would never give a dollar to Chicken Coop after what I witnessed.
The chicken is well worth all the accolades (Food Network), the sides are disappointing.
So Crispy, so delicious. All they do is chicken all the time, bring a chair - bring a friend and a grease bib !

Once you get past the line and overwhelming presence of the kitchen, this place is a must-eat. The chicken, fries, and sweet tea are one of my Charlotte staples now! If you're hungry, get the half bird, mixed!

I've been living in Charlotte for about 13 months now, and it took me this long to finally try the all-praised Price's Chicken Coop. I promise it won't take that long for me to return!   The chicken was fantastic and amazingly worth the hype. I had the 1/4 white meat chicken dinner.. comes with tater rounds, slaw, hushpuppies, and dinner roll. Also got sweet tea (an obvious good decision). The tater rounds were a little salty, but good. Slaw was surprisingly great and flavorful, not overly-mayo saturated. Chicken was very flavorful, crispy, not greasy and unbelievably tender. I was with another friend who got the chicken sandwich... which had breast and wing on a bun (bones included). A little odd, but I guess you're supposed to remove the bones yourself and make a sandwich.. ??   The service was tremendous also. The woman helping us was very nice and answered all questions willingly. Sometimes you go to well-known places for the first time and the cashier will be a little curt due to answering the same questions over-and-over... not the case here. Cashier was very, very nice and attentive. Even though it was lunchtime with lots of customers, we were in and out really quick.. about 5 minutes.   Also, expect to eat in your car... there's no where to sit. I understood this before going, so it was no surprise. Ended up eating on the trunk of my car, it was such a nice day it was great... felt like we were tailgating without the beer. The street was littered with chicken bones so we definitely weren't the first with this idea.

This is the real deal for fried chicken in Charlotte! It's a very efficient, operation doling out some of the best fried chicken I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. You can tell the business has been doing this for a long time and have mastered their craft!

This is an old school fried chicken joint.  Cash only, no seating, hole-in-the-wall goodness.  I've been jonesing for some good fried chicken since I moved to Charlotte and all I can say is " winner, winner, chicken dinner."    I go to a place like this for the chicken.  Period.  Sides be damned.  The bird is golden brown, super crispy, very well seasoned, and, most importantly, ridiculously juicy.  Juiciness is where most others fail.  Slightly greasy, but seriously, isn't that where flavor lives?  Could I eat this more than once a month?  Only if I got a personal defibrillator.  But I will be back frequently.
If you feel like eating fried chicken, this place is pretty good.

This place has the best fried chicken I've ever had my life. The only downfall is is that I do not live in Charlotte I will never be able to enjoy this chicken again. You don't know what you don't know until you have it and now my life is going to be incomplete without it

Charlotte - Uschhhhh! The chicken here is the best. Expect a long wait but its worth it. The chicken was juicy and not dry and seasoned just right. After eating please dont forget your fried Sweet Potato Pie "KLAWD"

Why the 5 stars you say? Prices never disappoints me. They are ALWAYS consistent. I can actually eat their chicken cold and still be happy. The customer base is super eclectic. The restaurant is subjectively charming and how can you not smile when you see people with shirts and ties sitting on the street curb eating chicken?   As we know there isn't anything special about fried chicken. Don't go buying fried chicken expecting some elaborate 20 step preparation process. Its just fried chicken. But fried chicken is comforting for everyone and always induces some type of nostalgia. Its a simple dish and Prices does it right: Moist, tastes like chicken and not overwhelmed with spices or anything, and lastly crispy batter.   They don't have real sides here. Just slaw, potato salad, taters and hush puppies. Although they offer other menu items, I only get chicken usually. Gizzards (yuck) are okay here too. =)   Thighs are just too greasy for me and breasts are too meaty. I like a 30% meat, 70% skin/batter mixture. So I'm a wing kinda guy and Price's has damn good crispy wings. My only complaint is that they chop off the wing tips. Yes I said it, I love wing tips! I'm still waiting for them to offer fried chicken skin. lol

Holy smokes this chicken was amazing. Cash only!  The only downside is that there is no seating inside, whatsoever.  Most people got the box of fried chicken and ate it inside their cars in the parking lot.  There's a little park next door but it was too cold to eat outside.   ORDERING - get in line behind someone (I believe there are several lines) and then know what you want to order.  If you get a "meal" which is the default it comes with tater tots, cole slaw, hush puppies and then the chicken.  You can specify what type of chicken you want as well.    FOOD - Since it was two of us, we got 1 meal and then I just got a side of dark meat (thigh and drumstick).    The tater tots are interesting because they are shaped like coins, but are SO GOOD.  So crispy and tasty.    Cole slaw wasn't bad, maybe a little creamy.  Hush puppies were also very tasty.  Had a fried onion taste almost.  Fried chicken - it was just the way I like it, crispy, crunchy, and crumbly.  Not like a thick piece of fried skin that seems like a coating.  The chicken was moist, hot and flavorful.  Definitely the best I've had.  Overall, worth coming to try - make sure you take a look at the hours and be prepared to eat in your car.  So crispy and delicious.

waiting in line to order is a treat -- you never know whom you will meet.  often, there seem to be 50 people ahead of you in line (on line for New Yorkers), but the line moves quickly.  The chicken is the apotheosis of fried chicken.  If it's going to kill you, it needs to taste this good.  take out only

My go to spot for fried chicken. Funny, when you go around lunch, people park and eat on the street, sometimes you see people sit on the lawn across the street enjoying their lunch, somewhat communal, but the main thing you see is everyone walking out with their white boxes of fried chicken goodness. Consistently good.   My usual is 1/4 white dinner, comes with a breast and a wing. In the box, is a nice portion of tater tots, two corn bread hush puppies and cole slaw, finally a white bread roll.   The fried perch was good as well as the fried shrimp.   There is a reason why Prices has been here for as long as they have.  Great place!

Whenever we have guests from out of town we always get them to try the friend chicken experience of Bojangles and more importantly.... Prices Chicken Coop.  When I first heard about this place from my dad it was hard for me to grasp the concept.... you just have to try the chicken. It's not dine in... just take out but the line is out the door for a reason.  I am not a liver person.... but I hear their fried liver is the best. I'm just in it for the chicken. It's unique and tasty.

I've lived in Charlotte 23 years and I FINALLY made my way inside Price's to sample their goodness. Who knows what took me so long but I can finally cross this one off of my bucket list!   There is nothing fancy about Price's. It's all take out and they do not accept credit/debit cards so bring cash or at least your debit card since there is an ATM on site. And when you enter the door, find a line....there's at least 4 of them and wait your turn.  The menu consists of fried dinners and sandwiches...chicken, shrimp, fish and a few sides. Each dinner comes with an abundance of potato rounds, hush puppies and slaw.    For my first meal from Price's I went with the 1/3 chicken white meal. The chicken had a nice coating which was not over spiced like some places and the chicken was moist and tender - the way good fried chicken should be. The potato rounds were a great addition as well as the hush puppies. The slaw was ok but I am not normally a fan of slaw anyway so I wasn't expecting much.  Price's gets busy all day long so allow enough time to get your meal and go. There is no dining space but I've seen people eating adjacent to the light rail across the street in nicer weather.  There is metered parking (25 cents for 15 minutes) on the street and Price's also has a small lot behind the building.  I can see why Price's is consistently voted best fried chicken. Living so close to here, I promise to be back soon!

The best fried chicken in all of Charlotte. Taking home a full of Price's chicken is one of the most satisfying feelings in the whole world.  It's crispy and easy to suck down, you tell yourself you're only going to have two pieces but end up having ten. The sides aren't anything special but they aren't bad. I wish they had mac n cheese but you don't get everything you wish for.  Not a sit down place but the staff is still friendly. It's best to call ahead, pick up your order, and then chow down.

A solid fried chicken establishment.  Despite the long lines, service moves fast.  A good value with local flavor.  I ordered the meal with chicken, hush puppies, coleslaw and tater tots.  The chicken is very crispy and well-seasoned.  Personally, I like a little heat and spice, but this was very good (and greasy).  The sweet tea is WAY too sweet for me, but then again, I'm from the west coast, so sweet tea is a foreign concept for me to begin with.

When a place has almost 200 reviews and an overall rating of 4 stars, there is a reason and there is truth to it.  I can tell you what anyone else on here writing a review will tell you - the fried chicken is good. Pretty great actually. The slaw didn't do it for me but the sweet tea will knock your socks off with diabetes it is so sweet. I mean this in a good way. Do yourself a favor and get the tea without ice. Or just buy a half gallon. Trust me.  I also ordered fried gizzards and while I thought they needed more flavoring, I almost ate the entire package before I got out the car. OOPS!   My coworker placed an order for a 1/4 dark sandwich which was a great deal for $3 and change. It even came with a side.  The lady who helped me at the counter was very patient with me and let me split my orders up since I was ordering for the office. I was prepared with what I was ordering and maybe that is why.  Excellent service, Excellent Fried Chicken and Excellent Sweet Tea.
Hands down, the best fried chicken I've ever had.  Sides aren't the greatest, but with chicken like this, who notices.  A true Charlotte legend !

Oh this chicken was so finger licking good. It didn't taste like it was processed with chemicals like KFC does.  This place was hella buzy on a Saturday afternoon.  My only complaint is that I got a chicken burger which is actually just a chicken leg (with bones) put in 2 buns, so I had to pull out the meat.

I got the white dinner, it was a TON of food. The chicken was so juicy and tender. Absolutely perfect! It comes with a roll, a bunch of mini hash browns and 2 hush puppies. It's really crowded at all times so be prepared to wait in line. CASH ONLY!!!!

It's pretty amazing fried chicken!!  That's literally all that really matters.  Yes, you're like going to wait in line at the very least for 5 minutes, but it's going to be worth it, so deal with it. I've never tried any of the other dishes at all unfortunately, but there is a full range of menu options and sides.  Each Chicken Dinner comes with tatter tot/hash browns that are "crispy goodness" and also a small side cup of coleslaw and a dinner roll.  I don't like coleslaw at all, but I tried it because everything else is good.  I still didn't like it but people say it's good so you be the judge for yourself.  My friend ordered the bbq sandwich which included the coleslaw on it which she was unaware of but she loved it.    Also, they make the best sweet tea on the planet!  Yes, I said it.  Don't waste your time getting one of the cups of sweet tea.  Pay the extra $1 or so and get a half gallon for yourself or a couple people and pay for a cup of ice and enjoy it.  We ordered just two cups and went to a nearby seating area to enjoy our food and the weather.  We loved the tea so much that my friend walked back to the store just get a half gallon so we could keep the refills flowing.  Come for the chicken, wait patiently in the quick line, and fall in love with the sweet tea.  You won't regret the trip.

Good God. This is ridiculously good chicken. Sides are meh but who the hell cares?  The best fried chicken I've ever had?  Perhaps not. I still am partial to Beach Road Chicken Dinners in Jax, FL and their sides are anything but meh but this is some damn good stuff!  Slap some hot sauce on it and I dare you to not start wolfing a drumstick in your car...
